  20bad_sentinel = "_NA_"
  21
  22
  23def replace_bad_with_sentinel(ar: List) -> numpy.ndarray:
  24    """
  25    Replace None/NaN entries in iterable with '_NA_'
  26    :param ar: iterable
  27    :return: one dimensional numpy array
  28    """
  29
  30    ar = numpy.array(ar)
  31    bads = pandas.isnull(ar)
  32    ar[bads] = bad_sentinel
  33    return ar
  34
  35
  36def ready_data_frame(d) -> Tuple[pandas.DataFrame, type]:
  37    """
  38    Convert an array-like object to a data frame for processing.
  39
  40    :param d: data frame like object to work with
  41    :return: dataframe with string-named columns
  42    """
  43    orig_type = type(d)
  44    if not isinstance(d, pandas.DataFrame):
  45        d = pandas.DataFrame(d)
  46    else:
  47        d = d.copy()
  48    d.columns = [str(c) for c in d.columns]  # convert column names to strings
  49    return d, orig_type
  50
  51
  52def back_to_orig_type_data_frame(
  53    d: pandas.DataFrame, orig_type: type
  54) -> Tuple[Any, List[str]]:
  55    """
  56    Convert data frame back to ndarray if that was the original type.
  57
  58    :param d: data frame
  59    :param orig_type: type of original object
  60    :return: converted result
  61    """
  62    if not isinstance(d, pandas.DataFrame):
  63        raise TypeError(
  64            "Expected result to be a pandas.DataFrame, found: " + str(type(d))
  65        )
  66    columns = [c for c in d.columns]
  67    if orig_type == numpy.ndarray:
  68        d = numpy.asarray(d)
  69    return d, columns

  72class VarTransform(abc.ABC):
  73    """
  74    Base class for vtreat transforms
  75    """
  76
  77    incoming_column_name_: str
  78    incoming_column_is_numeric_: bool
  79    derived_column_names_: List[str]
  80    need_cross_treatment_: bool
  81    treatment_: str
  82    refitter_: Optional[Callable]
  83    extra_args_: Optional[Dict[str, Any]]
  84    params_: Optional[Dict[str, Any]]
  85
  86    def __init__(
  87        self,
  88        *,
  89        incoming_column_name: str,
  90        incoming_column_is_numeric: bool,
  91        derived_column_names: Iterable[str],
  92        treatment: str,
  93    ):
  94        """
  95
  96        :param incoming_column_name:
  97        :param incoming_column_is_numeric:
  98        :param derived_column_names:
  99        :param treatment:
 100        """
 101
 102        assert isinstance(incoming_column_name, str)
 103        assert isinstance(incoming_column_is_numeric, bool)
 104        assert not isinstance(derived_column_names, str)
 105        derived_column_names = list(derived_column_names)
 106        assert len(derived_column_names) > 0
 107        assert numpy.all([isinstance(dni, str) for dni in derived_column_names])
 108        assert isinstance(treatment, str)
 109        self.incoming_column_name_ = incoming_column_name
 110        self.incoming_column_is_numeric_ = incoming_column_is_numeric
 111        self.derived_column_names_ = derived_column_names
 112        self.treatment_ = treatment
 113        self.need_cross_treatment_ = False
 114        self.refitter_ = None
 115        self.extra_args_ = None
 116        self.params_ = None
 117
 118    @abc.abstractmethod
 119    def transform(self, data_frame: pandas.DataFrame) -> pandas.DataFrame:
 120        """
 121        return a transformed data frame
 122
 123        :rtype: pandas.DataFrame
 124        :param data_frame: incoming values
 125        :return: transformed values
 126        """
 127
 128    @abc.abstractmethod
 129    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
 130        """
 131        Return description of transform as a data frame.
 132
 133        :return: description of transform.
 134        """

 137class TreatmentPlan:
 138    """
 139    Class to carry treatment plans.
 140    """
 141
 142    outcome_name: Optional[str]
 143    cols_to_copy: Tuple[str, ...]
 144    num_list: Tuple[str, ...]
 145    cat_list: Tuple[str, ...]
 146    xforms: Tuple[VarTransform, ...]
 147
 148    def __init__(
 149        self,
 150        *,
 151        outcome_name: Optional[str] = None,
 152        cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
 153        num_list: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
 154        cat_list: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
 155        xforms: Iterable[Optional[VarTransform]],
 156    ):
 157        self.outcome_name = outcome_name
 158        if cols_to_copy is None:
 159            self.cols_to_copy = tuple()
 160        else:
 161            assert not isinstance(cols_to_copy, str)
 162            self.cols_to_copy = tuple(cols_to_copy)
 163        if num_list is None:
 164            self.num_list = tuple()
 165        else:
 166            assert not isinstance(num_list, str)
 167            self.num_list = tuple(num_list)
 168        if cat_list is None:
 169            self.cat_list = tuple()
 170        else:
 171            assert not isinstance(cat_list, str)
 172            self.cat_list = tuple(cat_list)
 173        non_empty_xforms: List[VarTransform] = [x for x in xforms if x is not None]
 174        self.xforms = tuple(non_empty_xforms)
 175        for c in self.cols_to_copy:
 176            assert isinstance(c, str)
 177        for c in self.num_list:
 178            assert isinstance(c, str)
 179        for c in self.cat_list:
 180            assert isinstance(c, str)
 181        if len(self.xforms) < 1:
 182            raise ValueError("no treatments generated")
 183        for x in self.xforms:
 184            assert isinstance(x, VarTransform)
 185

 187class MappedCodeTransform(VarTransform):
 188    """Class for transforms that are a dictionary mapping of strings to numeric values"""
 189
 190    def __init__(
 191        self,
 192        *,
 193        incoming_column_name: str,
 194        derived_column_name: str,
 195        treatment: str,
 196        code_book: pandas.DataFrame,
 197    ):
 198        """
 199
 200        :param incoming_column_name:
 201        :param derived_column_name:
 202        :param treatment:
 203        :param code_book: Pandas dataframe mapping values to impact codes
 204        """
 205
 206        VarTransform.__init__(
 207            self,
 208            incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 209            incoming_column_is_numeric=False,
 210            derived_column_names=[derived_column_name],
 211            treatment=treatment,
 212        )
 213        self.code_book_ = code_book
 214
 215    def transform(self, data_frame: pandas.DataFrame) -> pandas.DataFrame:
 216        """
 217        return a transformed data frame
 218
 219        :rtype: pandas.DataFrame
 220        :param data_frame: incoming values
 221        :return: transformed values
 222        """
 223
 224        incoming_column_name = self.incoming_column_name_
 225        derived_column_name = self.derived_column_names_[0]
 226        sf = pandas.DataFrame({incoming_column_name: data_frame[incoming_column_name]})
 227        bad_posns = vtreat.util.is_bad(sf[incoming_column_name])
 228        sf.loc[bad_posns, incoming_column_name] = bad_sentinel
 229        res = pandas.merge(
 230            sf, self.code_book_, on=[self.incoming_column_name_], how="left", sort=False
 231        )  # ordered by left table rows
 232        # could also try pandas .map()
 233        res = res[[derived_column_name]].copy()
 234        res.loc[vtreat.util.is_bad(res[derived_column_name]), derived_column_name] = 0.0
 235        return res
 236
 237    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
 238        """
 239        Return description of transform as a data frame.
 240
 241        :return: description of transform.
 242        """
 243
 244        description = pandas.DataFrame(
 245            {
 246                "treatment_class": "MappedCodeTransform",
 247                "treatment": self.treatment_,
 248                "orig_var": self.incoming_column_name_,
 249                "orig_was_numeric": self.incoming_column_is_numeric_,
 250                "variable": self.derived_column_names_[0],
 251                "value": replace_bad_with_sentinel(
 252                    self.code_book_[self.incoming_column_name_]
 253                ),
 254                "replacement": self.code_book_[self.derived_column_names_[0]].copy(),
 255            }
 256        )
 257        return description
 258

 260class YAwareMappedCodeTransform(MappedCodeTransform):
 261    """Class for transforms that are a y-aware dictionary mapping of values"""
 262
 263    def __init__(
 264        self,
 265        incoming_column_name: str,
 266        derived_column_name: str,
 267        treatment: str,
 268        code_book: pandas.DataFrame,
 269        refitter,
 270        extra_args: Optional[Dict[str, Any]],
 271        params: Dict[str, Any],
 272    ):
 273        """
 274
 275        :param incoming_column_name: name of incoming column
 276        :param derived_column_name: name of incoming column
 277        :param treatment: name of treatment
 278        :param code_book: pandas data frame mapping values to codes
 279        :param refitter: function to re-fit
 280        :param extra_args: extra args for fit_* functions
 281        :param params: configuration control parameters
 282        """
 283
 284        MappedCodeTransform.__init__(
 285            self,
 286            incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 287            derived_column_name=derived_column_name,
 288            treatment=treatment,
 289            code_book=code_book,
 290        )
 291        self.need_cross_treatment_ = True
 292        self.refitter_ = refitter
 293        self.extra_args_ = extra_args
 294        self.params_ = params

 297class CleanNumericTransform(VarTransform):
 298    """Class for numeric column cleaner."""
 299
 300    def __init__(self, *, incoming_column_name: str, replacement_value: float):
 301        """
 302
 303        :param incoming_column_name:
 304        :param replacement_value:
 305        """
 306
 307        VarTransform.__init__(
 308            self,
 309            incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 310            incoming_column_is_numeric=True,
 311            derived_column_names=[incoming_column_name],
 312            treatment="clean_copy",
 313        )
 314        self.replacement_value_ = replacement_value
 315
 316    def transform(self, data_frame: pandas.DataFrame) -> pandas.DataFrame:
 317        """
 318        return a transformed data frame
 319
 320        :rtype: pandas.DataFrame
 321        :param data_frame: incoming values
 322        :return: transformed values
 323        """
 324
 325        col = vtreat.util.safe_to_numeric_array(data_frame[self.incoming_column_name_])
 326        bad_posns = vtreat.util.is_bad(col)
 327        col[bad_posns] = self.replacement_value_
 328        res = pandas.DataFrame({self.derived_column_names_[0]: col})
 329        return res
 330
 331    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
 332        """
 333        Return description of transform as a data frame.
 334
 335        :return: description of transform.
 336        """
 337
 338        description = pandas.DataFrame(
 339            {
 340                "treatment_class": ["CleanNumericTransform"],
 341                "treatment": [self.treatment_],
 342                "orig_var": [self.incoming_column_name_],
 343                "orig_was_numeric": [self.incoming_column_is_numeric_],
 344                "variable": [self.derived_column_names_[0]],
 345                "value": [bad_sentinel],
 346                "replacement": [self.replacement_value_],
 347            }
 348        )
 349        return description

 352class IndicateMissingTransform(VarTransform):
 353    """Class for missing value indicator."""
 354
 355    def __init__(
 356        self,
 357        *,
 358        incoming_column_name: str,
 359        incoming_column_is_numeric: bool,
 360        derived_column_name: str,
 361    ):
 362        """
 363
 364        :param incoming_column_name:
 365        :param derived_column_name:
 366        """
 367
 368        VarTransform.__init__(
 369            self,
 370            incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 371            incoming_column_is_numeric=incoming_column_is_numeric,
 372            derived_column_names=[derived_column_name],
 373            treatment="missing_indicator",
 374        )
 375
 376    def transform(self, data_frame: pandas.DataFrame) -> pandas.DataFrame:
 377        """
 378        return a transformed data frame
 379
 380        :rtype: pandas.DataFrame
 381        :param data_frame: incoming values
 382        :return: transformed values
 383        """
 384
 385        col = vtreat.util.is_bad(data_frame[self.incoming_column_name_])
 386        res = pandas.DataFrame({self.derived_column_names_[0]: col + 0.0})
 387        return res
 388
 389    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
 390        """
 391        Return description of transform as a data frame.
 392
 393        :return: description of transform.
 394        """
 395        description = pandas.DataFrame(
 396            {
 397                "treatment_class": ["IndicateMissingTransform"],
 398                "treatment": [self.treatment_],
 399                "orig_var": [self.incoming_column_name_],
 400                "orig_was_numeric": [self.incoming_column_is_numeric_],
 401                "variable": [self.derived_column_names_[0]],
 402                "value": [bad_sentinel],
 403                "replacement": [1.0],
 404            }
 405        )
 406        return description

 409def fit_clean_code(
 410    *,
 411    incoming_column_name: str,
 412    x,
 413    params: Dict[str, Any],
 414    imputation_map: Dict[str, Any],
 415) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
 416    """
 417    Fit numeric clean column imputation transform
 418
 419    :param incoming_column_name: name of column
 420    :param x: training values for column
 421    :param params: control parameter dictionary
 422    :param imputation_map: per-column map to imputation strategies or values
 423    :return: transform
 424    """
 425
 426    if not vtreat.util.numeric_has_range(x):
 427        return None
 428    replacement = params["missingness_imputation"]
 429    try:
 430        replacement = imputation_map[incoming_column_name]
 431    except KeyError:
 432        pass
 433    if vtreat.util.can_convert_v_to_numeric(replacement):
 434        replacement_value = 0.0 + replacement
 435    elif callable(replacement):
 436        replacement_value = vtreat.util.summarize_column(x, fn=replacement)
 437    else:
 438        raise TypeError(
 439            "unexpected imputation type "
 440            + str(type(replacement))
 441            + " ("
 442            + incoming_column_name
 443            + ")"
 444        )
 445    if (
 446        pandas.isnull(replacement_value)
 447        or math.isnan(replacement_value)
 448        or math.isinf(replacement_value)
 449    ):
 450        raise ValueError(
 451            "replacement was bad "
 452            + incoming_column_name
 453            + ": "
 454            + str(replacement_value)
 455        )
 456    return CleanNumericTransform(
 457        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name, replacement_value=replacement_value
 458    )
 459

 461def fit_regression_impact_code(
 462    *,
 463    incoming_column_name: str,
 464    x,
 465    y,
 466    extra_args: Optional[Dict[str, Any]],
 467    params: Dict[str, Any],
 468) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
 469    """
 470    Fit regression impact code transform
 471
 472    :param incoming_column_name:
 473    :param x: training explanatory values
 474    :param y: training dependent values
 475    :param extra_args: optional extra arguments for fit_ methods
 476    :param params: control parameter dictionary
 477    :return:
 478    """
 479
 480    if (len(x) <= 1) or (len(set(x)) <= 1):
 481        return None
 482    if params["use_hierarchical_estimate"]:
 483        cf = vtreat.util.pooled_impact_estimate(x, y)
 484        cf["_impact_code"] = cf["estimate"] - cf["grand_mean"]
 485    else:
 486        cf = vtreat.util.grouped_by_x_statistics(x, y)
 487        cf["_impact_code"] = cf["_group_mean"] - cf["_gm"]
 488    if cf.shape[0] <= 1:
 489        return None
 490    sf = cf.loc[:, ["x", "_impact_code"]].reset_index(drop=True, inplace=False)
 491    newcol = incoming_column_name + "_impact_code"
 492    sf.columns = [incoming_column_name, newcol]
 493    return YAwareMappedCodeTransform(
 494        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 495        derived_column_name=newcol,
 496        treatment="impact_code",
 497        code_book=sf,
 498        refitter=fit_regression_impact_code,
 499        extra_args=extra_args,
 500        params=params,
 501    )
 502
 503
 504def fit_regression_deviation_code(
 505    *,
 506    incoming_column_name: str,
 507    x,
 508    y,
 509    extra_args: Optional[Dict[str, Any]],
 510    params: Dict[str, Any],
 511) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
 512    """
 513    Fit regression deviation code transform
 514
 515    :param incoming_column_name:
 516    :param x: training explanatory values
 517    :param y: training dependent values
 518    :param extra_args: optional extra arguments for fit_ methods
 519    :param params: control parameter dictionary
 520    :return:
 521    """
 522
 523    if (len(x) <= 1) or (len(set(x)) <= 1):
 524        return None
 525    sf = vtreat.util.grouped_by_x_statistics(x, y)
 526    sf["_deviation_code"] = numpy.sqrt(sf["_var"])
 527    sf = sf.loc[:, ["x", "_deviation_code"]].copy()
 528    if sf.shape[0] <= 1:
 529        return None
 530    newcol = incoming_column_name + "_deviation_code"
 531    sf.columns = [incoming_column_name, newcol]
 532    return YAwareMappedCodeTransform(
 533        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 534        derived_column_name=newcol,
 535        treatment="deviation_code",
 536        code_book=sf,
 537        refitter=fit_regression_deviation_code,
 538        extra_args=extra_args,
 539        params=params,
 540    )
 541
 542
 543def fit_binomial_impact_code(
 544    *,
 545    incoming_column_name: str,
 546    x,
 547    y,
 548    extra_args: Dict[str, Any],
 549    params: Dict[str, Any],
 550) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
 551    """
 552    Fit categorical impact code.
 553
 554    :param incoming_column_name:
 555    :param x: training explanatory values
 556    :param y: training dependent values
 557    :param extra_args: required extra arguments for fit_ methods
 558    :param params: control parameter dictionary
 559    :return:
 560    """
 561    if (len(x) <= 1) or (len(set(x)) <= 1):
 562        return None
 563    outcome_target = (
 564        extra_args["outcome_target"],
 565    )  # TODO: document why this is a tuple
 566    var_suffix = extra_args["var_suffix"]
 567    y = numpy.asarray(numpy.asarray(y) == outcome_target, dtype=float)
 568    eps = 1.0e-3
 569    if params["use_hierarchical_estimate"]:
 570        cf = vtreat.util.pooled_impact_estimate(x, y)
 571        cf["_logit_code"] = numpy.log(
 572            (numpy.maximum(cf["estimate"], 0.0) + eps)
 573            / (numpy.maximum(cf["grand_mean"], 0.0) + eps)
 574        )
 575    else:
 576        cf = vtreat.util.grouped_by_x_statistics(x, y)
 577        cf["_logit_code"] = numpy.log(
 578            (numpy.maximum(cf["_group_mean"], 0.0) + eps)
 579            / (numpy.maximum(cf["_gm"], 0.0) + eps)
 580        )
 581    if cf.shape[0] <= 1:
 582        return None
 583    sf = cf.loc[:, ["x", "_logit_code"]].reset_index(drop=True, inplace=False)
 584    newcol = incoming_column_name + "_logit_code" + var_suffix
 585    sf.columns = [incoming_column_name, newcol]
 586    return YAwareMappedCodeTransform(
 587        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 588        derived_column_name=newcol,
 589        treatment="logit_code",
 590        code_book=sf,
 591        refitter=fit_binomial_impact_code,
 592        extra_args=extra_args,
 593        params=params,
 594    )

 597class IndicatorCodeTransform(VarTransform):
 598    """Class for indicator codes"""
 599
 600    def __init__(
 601        self,
 602        *,
 603        incoming_column_name: str,
 604        derived_column_names: List[str],
 605        levels: List,
 606        sparse_indicators: bool = False,
 607    ):
 608        """
 609
 610        :param incoming_column_name:
 611        :param derived_column_names:
 612        :param levels: leves we are encoding to indicators
 613        :param sparse_indicators: if True use sparse data structure
 614        """
 615        VarTransform.__init__(
 616            self,
 617            incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 618            incoming_column_is_numeric=False,
 619            derived_column_names=derived_column_names,
 620            treatment="indicator_code",
 621        )
 622        self.levels_ = levels
 623        self.sparse_indicators_ = sparse_indicators
 624
 625    def transform(self, data_frame):
 626        """
 627        return a transformed data frame
 628
 629        :rtype: pandas.DataFrame
 630        :param data_frame: incoming values
 631        :return: transformed values
 632        """
 633
 634        incoming_column_name = self.incoming_column_name_
 635        sf = pandas.DataFrame({incoming_column_name: data_frame[incoming_column_name]})
 636        bad_posns = vtreat.util.is_bad(sf[incoming_column_name])
 637        sf.loc[bad_posns, incoming_column_name] = bad_sentinel
 638        col = sf[self.incoming_column_name_]
 639
 640        def f(i: int):
 641            """transform one column"""
 642            v = numpy.asarray(col == self.levels_[i]) + 0.0  # return numeric 0/1 coding
 643            if self.sparse_indicators_:
 644                v = pandas.arrays.SparseArray(v, fill_value=0.0)
 645            return v
 646
 647        res = None
 648        for ii in range(len(self.levels_)):
 649            if res is None:
 650                res = pandas.DataFrame({self.derived_column_names_[ii]: f(ii)})
 651            else:
 652                res[self.derived_column_names_[ii]] = f(ii)
 653        return res
 654
 655    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
 656        """
 657        Return description of transform as a data frame.
 658
 659        :return: description of transform.
 660        """
 661
 662        description = pandas.DataFrame(
 663            {
 664                "treatment_class": "IndicatorCodeTransform",
 665                "treatment": self.treatment_,
 666                "orig_var": self.incoming_column_name_,
 667                "orig_was_numeric": self.incoming_column_is_numeric_,
 668                "variable": self.derived_column_names_.copy(),
 669                "value": replace_bad_with_sentinel(self.levels_),
 670                "replacement": 1.0,
 671            }
 672        )
 673        return description
 674
 675
 676def fit_indicator_code(
 677    *,
 678    incoming_column_name: str,
 679    x,
 680    min_fraction: float = 0.0,
 681    max_levels: Optional[int] = None,
 682    sparse_indicators: bool = False,
 683) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
 684    """
 685    Fit indicator codes
 686
 687    :param incoming_column_name:
 688    :param x: training explanatory variables
 689    :param min_fraction:
 690    :param max_levels:
 691    :param sparse_indicators:
 692    :return:
 693    """
 694
 695    sf = pandas.DataFrame({incoming_column_name: x})
 696    bad_posns = vtreat.util.is_bad(sf[incoming_column_name])
 697    sf.loc[bad_posns, incoming_column_name] = bad_sentinel
 698    counts = sf[incoming_column_name].value_counts()
 699    n = sf.shape[0]
 700    counts = counts[counts > 0]
 701    counts = counts[counts >= min_fraction * n]  # no more than 1/min_fraction symbols
 702    levels = [str(v) for v in counts.index]
 703    if (max_levels is not None) and (len(levels) > max_levels):
 704        level_frame = pandas.DataFrame({"levels": levels, "counts": counts})
 705        level_frame.sort_values(
 706            by=["counts", "levels"],
 707            ascending=[False, True],
 708            inplace=True,
 709            axis=0,
 710            ignore_index=True,
 711        )
 712        value_vec = level_frame["levels"].values
 713        levels = [value_vec[i] for i in range(max_levels)]
 714    if len(levels) < 1:
 715        return None
 716    return IndicatorCodeTransform(
 717        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 718        derived_column_names=vtreat.util.build_level_codes(
 719            incoming_column_name, levels
 720        ),
 721        levels=levels,
 722        sparse_indicators=sparse_indicators,
 723    )
 724
 725
 726def fit_prevalence_code(incoming_column_name: str, x) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
 727    """
 728    Fit a prevalence code
 729
 730    :param incoming_column_name:
 731    :param x: training explanatory values
 732    :return:
 733    """
 734
 735    sf = pandas.DataFrame({"x": x})
 736    bad_posns = vtreat.util.is_bad(sf["x"])
 737    sf.loc[bad_posns, "x"] = bad_sentinel
 738    sf.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
 739    n = sf.shape[0]
 740    sf["_ni"] = 1.0
 741    sf = pandas.DataFrame(sf.groupby("x")["_ni"].sum())
 742    sf.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=False)
 743    sf["_prev"] = sf["_ni"] / n
 744    sf = sf.loc[:, ["x", "_prev"]].copy()
 745    newcol = incoming_column_name + "_prevalence_code"
 746    sf.columns = [incoming_column_name, newcol]
 747    sf[incoming_column_name] = sf[incoming_column_name].astype(str)
 748    sf.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
 749    return MappedCodeTransform(
 750        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
 751        derived_column_name=newcol,
 752        treatment="prevalence_code",
 753        code_book=sf,
 754    )
 755
 756
 757# noinspection PyPep8Naming
 758def _prepare_variable_lists(
 759    *,
 760    X,
 761    cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]],
 762    var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]],
 763) -> Tuple[List[str], List[str], List[str], List[str], List[str]]:
 764    """
 765    Prepare lists of variables for variable treatment.
 766
 767    :param X: dependent variables
 768    :param cols_to_copy: columns to copy
 769    :param var_list: dependent variable names, if empty all non outcome and copy columns are used
 770    :return: cat_list, cols_to_copy, mis_list, num_list, var_list lists
 771    """
 772    if var_list is None:
 773        var_list = list(X.columns)
 774    else:
 775        var_list = list(var_list)
 776    if len(var_list) < 1:
 777        var_list = list(X.columns)
 778    assert len(var_list) > 0
 779    if cols_to_copy is None:
 780        cols_to_copy = []
 781    else:
 782        cols_to_copy = list(cols_to_copy)
 783    copy_set = set(cols_to_copy)
 784    var_list = [co for co in var_list if (not (co in copy_set))]
 785    v_counts = {v: vtreat.util.get_unique_value_count(X[v]) for v in var_list}
 786    var_list = {v for v in var_list if v_counts[v] > 1}
 787    if len(var_list) <= 0:
 788        raise ValueError("no variables")
 789    n = X.shape[0]
 790    all_bad: List[str] = []
 791    mis_list: List[str] = []
 792    for vi in var_list:
 793        n_bad = numpy.sum(vtreat.util.is_bad(X[vi]))
 794        if n_bad >= n:
 795            all_bad.append(vi)
 796        if (n_bad > 0) and (n_bad < n):
 797            mis_list.append(vi)
 798    var_list = [co for co in var_list if (not (co in set(all_bad)))]
 799    num_list = [co for co in var_list if vtreat.util.can_convert_v_to_numeric(X[co])]
 800    cat_list = [co for co in var_list if co not in set(num_list)]
 801    id_like = [co for co in cat_list if v_counts[co] >= n]
 802    if len(id_like) > 0:
 803        warnings.warn(
 804            "variable(s) "
 805            + ", ".join(id_like)
 806            + " have unique values per-row, dropping"
 807        )
 808        cat_list = [co for co in var_list if co not in set(id_like)]
 809    return cat_list, cols_to_copy, mis_list, num_list, var_list
 810
 811
 812# noinspection PyPep8Naming
 813def fit_numeric_outcome_treatment(
 814    *,
 815    X,
 816    y,
 817    var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]],
 818    outcome_name: str,
 819    cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]],
 820    params: Dict[str, Any],
 821    imputation_map: Dict[str, Any],
 822) -> TreatmentPlan:
 823    """
 824    Fit set of treatments in a regression situation.
 825
 826    :param X: training explanatory values
 827    :param y: training dependent values
 828    :param var_list: list of dependent variable names, if empty all non outcome and copy columns are used
 829    :param outcome_name: name for outcome column
 830    :param cols_to_copy: list of columns to copy to output
 831    :param params: control parameter dictionary
 832    :param imputation_map: per-column map to imputation strategies or values
 833    :return: transform plan
 834    """
 835    cat_list, cols_to_copy, mis_list, num_list, var_list = _prepare_variable_lists(
 836        X=X, cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy, var_list=var_list
 837    )
 838    xforms: List[Optional[VarTransform]] = []
 839    if "missing_indicator" in params["coders"]:
 840        num_set = set(num_list)
 841        for vi in mis_list:
 842            xforms.append(
 843                IndicateMissingTransform(
 844                    incoming_column_name=vi,
 845                    incoming_column_is_numeric=vi in num_set,
 846                    derived_column_name=vi + "_is_bad",
 847                )
 848            )
 849    if "clean_copy" in params["coders"]:
 850        for vi in num_list:
 851            xform = fit_clean_code(
 852                incoming_column_name=vi,
 853                x=X[vi],
 854                params=params,
 855                imputation_map=imputation_map,
 856            )
 857            if xform is not None:
 858                xforms.append(xform)
 859    for vi in cat_list:
 860        if "impact_code" in params["coders"]:
 861            xforms.append(
 862                fit_regression_impact_code(
 863                    incoming_column_name=vi,
 864                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
 865                    y=y,
 866                    extra_args=None,
 867                    params=params,
 868                )
 869            )
 870        if "deviation_code" in params["coders"]:
 871            xforms.append(
 872                fit_regression_deviation_code(
 873                    incoming_column_name=vi,
 874                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
 875                    y=y,
 876                    extra_args=None,
 877                    params=params,
 878                )
 879            )
 880        if "prevalence_code" in params["coders"]:
 881            xforms.append(
 882                fit_prevalence_code(incoming_column_name=vi, x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]))
 883            )
 884        if "indicator_code" in params["coders"]:
 885            xforms.append(
 886                fit_indicator_code(
 887                    incoming_column_name=vi,
 888                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
 889                    min_fraction=params["indicator_min_fraction"],
 890                    sparse_indicators=params["sparse_indicators"],
 891                )
 892            )
 893    for stp in params["user_transforms"]:
 894        stp.fit(X=X[var_list], y=y)
 895    return TreatmentPlan(
 896        outcome_name=outcome_name,
 897        cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy,
 898        num_list=num_list,
 899        cat_list=cat_list,
 900        xforms=xforms,
 901    )
 902
 903
 904# noinspection PyPep8Naming
 905def fit_binomial_outcome_treatment(
 906    *,
 907    X,
 908    y,
 909    outcome_target,
 910    var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]],
 911    outcome_name: str,
 912    cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]],
 913    params: Dict[str, Any],
 914    imputation_map: Dict[str, Any],
 915) -> TreatmentPlan:
 916    """
 917
 918    :param X: training explanatory values
 919    :param y: training dependent values
 920    :param outcome_target: dependent value to consider positive or in class
 921    :param var_list: list of variables to process, if empty all non outcome and copy columns are used
 922    :param outcome_name: name for outcome column
 923    :param cols_to_copy: list of columns to copy to output
 924    :param params: control parameter dictionary
 925    :param imputation_map: per-column map to imputation strategies or values
 926    :return: transform plan
 927    """
 928    cat_list, cols_to_copy, mis_list, num_list, var_list = _prepare_variable_lists(
 929        X=X, cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy, var_list=var_list
 930    )
 931    xforms: List[Optional[VarTransform]] = []
 932    if "missing_indicator" in params["coders"]:
 933        num_set = set(num_list)
 934        for vi in mis_list:
 935            xforms.append(
 936                IndicateMissingTransform(
 937                    incoming_column_name=vi,
 938                    incoming_column_is_numeric=vi in num_set,
 939                    derived_column_name=vi + "_is_bad",
 940                )
 941            )
 942    if "clean_copy" in params["coders"]:
 943        for vi in num_list:
 944            xform = fit_clean_code(
 945                incoming_column_name=vi,
 946                x=X[vi],
 947                params=params,
 948                imputation_map=imputation_map,
 949            )
 950            if xform is not None:
 951                xforms.append(xform)
 952    extra_args = {"outcome_target": outcome_target, "var_suffix": ""}
 953    for vi in cat_list:
 954        if "logit_code" in params["coders"]:
 955            xforms.append(
 956                fit_binomial_impact_code(
 957                    incoming_column_name=vi,
 958                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
 959                    y=y,
 960                    extra_args=extra_args,
 961                    params=params,
 962                )
 963            )
 964        if "prevalence_code" in params["coders"]:
 965            xforms.append(
 966                fit_prevalence_code(incoming_column_name=vi, x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]))
 967            )
 968        if "indicator_code" in params["coders"]:
 969            xforms.append(
 970                fit_indicator_code(
 971                    incoming_column_name=vi,
 972                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
 973                    min_fraction=params["indicator_min_fraction"],
 974                    sparse_indicators=params["sparse_indicators"],
 975                )
 976            )
 977    for stp in params["user_transforms"]:
 978        stp.fit(X=X[var_list], y=y)
 979    return TreatmentPlan(
 980        outcome_name=outcome_name,
 981        cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy,
 982        num_list=num_list,
 983        cat_list=cat_list,
 984        xforms=xforms,
 985    )
 986

 988# noinspection PyPep8Naming
 989def fit_multinomial_outcome_treatment(
 990    *,
 991    X,
 992    y,
 993    var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]],
 994    outcome_name: str,
 995    cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]],
 996    params: Dict[str, Any],
 997    imputation_map: Dict[str, Any],
 998) -> TreatmentPlan:
 999    """
1000    Fit a variable treatment for multinomial outcomes.
1001
1002    :param X: training explanatory values
1003    :param y: training dependent values
1004    :param var_list: list of variables to process, if empty all non outcome and copy columns are used
1005    :param outcome_name: name for outcome column
1006    :param cols_to_copy: list of columns to copy to output
1007    :param params: control parameter dictionary
1008    :param imputation_map: per-column map to imputation strategies or values
1009    :return:
1010    """
1011
1012    outcomes = [oi for oi in set(y)]
1013    assert len(outcomes) > 1
1014    cat_list, cols_to_copy, mis_list, num_list, var_list = _prepare_variable_lists(
1015        X=X, cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy, var_list=var_list
1016    )
1017    xforms: List[Optional[VarTransform]] = []
1018    if "missing_indicator" in params["coders"]:
1019        num_set = set(num_list)
1020        for vi in mis_list:
1021            xforms.append(
1022                IndicateMissingTransform(
1023                    incoming_column_name=vi,
1024                    incoming_column_is_numeric=vi in num_set,
1025                    derived_column_name=vi + "_is_bad",
1026                )
1027            )
1028    if "clean_copy" in params["coders"]:
1029        for vi in num_list:
1030            xform = fit_clean_code(
1031                incoming_column_name=vi,
1032                x=X[vi],
1033                params=params,
1034                imputation_map=imputation_map,
1035            )
1036            if xform is not None:
1037                xforms.append(xform)
1038    for vi in cat_list:
1039        for outcome in outcomes:
1040            if "impact_code" in params["coders"]:
1041                extra_args = {
1042                    "outcome_target": outcome,
1043                    "var_suffix": ("_" + str(outcome)),
1044                }
1045                xforms.append(
1046                    fit_binomial_impact_code(
1047                        incoming_column_name=vi,
1048                        x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
1049                        y=y,
1050                        extra_args=extra_args,
1051                        params=params,
1052                    )
1053                )
1054        if "prevalence_code" in params["coders"]:
1055            xforms.append(
1056                fit_prevalence_code(incoming_column_name=vi, x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]))
1057            )
1058        if "indicator_code" in params["coders"]:
1059            xforms.append(
1060                fit_indicator_code(
1061                    incoming_column_name=vi,
1062                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
1063                    min_fraction=params["indicator_min_fraction"],
1064                    sparse_indicators=params["sparse_indicators"],
1065                )
1066            )
1067    for stp in params["user_transforms"]:
1068        stp.fit(X=X[var_list], y=y)
1069    return TreatmentPlan(
1070        outcome_name=outcome_name,
1071        cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy,
1072        num_list=num_list,
1073        cat_list=cat_list,
1074        xforms=xforms,
1075    )
1076

1078# noinspection PyPep8Naming
1079def fit_unsupervised_treatment(
1080    *,
1081    X,
1082    var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]],
1083    outcome_name: str,
1084    cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]],
1085    params: Dict[str, Any],
1086    imputation_map: Dict[str, Any],
1087) -> TreatmentPlan:
1088    """
1089    Fit a data treatment in the unsupervised case.
1090
1091    :param X: training explanatory values
1092    :param var_list: list of variables to process, if empty all non copy columns are used
1093    :param outcome_name: name for outcome column
1094    :param cols_to_copy: list of columns to copy to output
1095    :param params: control parameter dictionary
1096    :param imputation_map: per-column map to imputation strategies or values
1097    :return:
1098    """
1099
1100    cat_list, cols_to_copy, mis_list, num_list, var_list = _prepare_variable_lists(
1101        X=X, cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy, var_list=var_list
1102    )
1103    xforms: List[Optional[VarTransform]] = []
1104    if "missing_indicator" in params["coders"]:
1105        num_set = set(num_list)
1106        for vi in mis_list:
1107            xforms.append(
1108                IndicateMissingTransform(
1109                    incoming_column_name=vi,
1110                    incoming_column_is_numeric=vi in num_set,
1111                    derived_column_name=vi + "_is_bad",
1112                )
1113            )
1114    if "clean_copy" in params["coders"]:
1115        for vi in num_list:
1116            xform = fit_clean_code(
1117                incoming_column_name=vi,
1118                x=X[vi],
1119                params=params,
1120                imputation_map=imputation_map,
1121            )
1122            if xform is not None:
1123                xforms.append(xform)
1124    for vi in cat_list:
1125        if "prevalence_code" in params["coders"]:
1126            xforms.append(
1127                fit_prevalence_code(incoming_column_name=vi, x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]))
1128            )
1129        if "indicator_code" in params["coders"]:
1130            xforms.append(
1131                fit_indicator_code(
1132                    incoming_column_name=vi,
1133                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
1134                    min_fraction=params["indicator_min_fraction"],
1135                    max_levels=params["indicator_max_levels"],
1136                    sparse_indicators=params["sparse_indicators"],
1137                )
1138            )
1139    for stp in params["user_transforms"]:
1140        stp.fit(X=X[var_list], y=None)
1141    return TreatmentPlan(
1142        outcome_name=outcome_name,
1143        cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy,
1144        num_list=num_list,
1145        cat_list=cat_list,
1146        xforms=xforms,
1147    )

1149
1150def pre_prep_frame(
1151    x: pandas.DataFrame,
1152    *,
1153    col_list: Optional[Iterable[str]],
1154    cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]],
1155    cat_cols: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
1156) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1157    """
1158    Create a copy of pandas.DataFrame x restricted to col_list union cols_to_copy with col_list - cols_to_copy
1159    converted to only string and numeric types.  New pandas.DataFrame has trivial indexing.  If col_list
1160    is empty it is interpreted as all columns.
1161
1162    :param x:
1163    :param col_list:
1164    :param cols_to_copy:
1165    :param cat_cols:
1166    :return:
1167    """
1168
1169    if cols_to_copy is None:
1170        cols_to_copy = []
1171    else:
1172        cols_to_copy = list(cols_to_copy)
1173    if col_list is None:
1174        col_list = []
1175    else:
1176        col_list = list(col_list)
1177    if len(col_list) <= 0:
1178        col_list = list(x.columns)
1179    x_set = set(x.columns)
1180    col_set = set(col_list)
1181    for ci in cols_to_copy:
1182        if (ci in x_set) and (ci not in col_set):
1183            col_list.append(ci)
1184    col_set = set(col_list)
1185    missing_cols = col_set - x_set
1186    if len(missing_cols) > 0:
1187        raise KeyError("referred to not-present columns " + str(missing_cols))
1188    cset = set(cols_to_copy)
1189    if len(col_list) <= 0:
1190        raise ValueError("no variables")
1191    x = x.loc[:, col_list]
1192    x = x.reset_index(inplace=False, drop=True)
1193    cat_col_set = None
1194    if cat_cols is not None:
1195        cat_col_set = set(cat_cols)
1196    for c in x.columns:
1197        if c in cset:
1198            continue
1199        bad_ind = vtreat.util.is_bad(x[c])
1200        if cat_col_set is not None:
1201            numeric_col = c not in cat_col_set
1202        else:
1203            numeric_col = vtreat.util.can_convert_v_to_numeric(x[c])
1204        if numeric_col:
1205            x[c] = vtreat.util.safe_to_numeric_array(x[c])
1206        else:
1207            # https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22231592/pandas-change-data-type-of-series-to-string
1208            x[c] = x[c].astype(str)
1209        x.loc[bad_ind, c] = None
1210    return x
1211
1212
1213def _mean_of_single_column_pandas_list(val_list: Iterable[pandas.DataFrame]) -> float:
1214    """
1215    Compute the mean of non-nan positions of a bunch of single column data frames
1216
1217    :param val_list: a list of single column Pandas data frames
1218    :return: mean, or numpy.nan if there are no values
1219    """
1220
1221    if val_list is None:
1222        return numpy.nan
1223    val_list = [v for v in val_list]
1224    if len(val_list) <= 0:
1225        return numpy.nan
1226    if len(val_list) <= 1:
1227        d = val_list[0]
1228    else:
1229        d = pandas.concat(val_list, axis=0, sort=False)
1230    col = d.columns[0]
1231    d = d.loc[numpy.logical_not(vtreat.util.is_bad(d[col])), [col]]
1232    if d.shape[0] < 1:
1233        return numpy.nan
1234    res = numpy.mean(d[col].values)
1235    assert isinstance(res, float)  # type hint for PyCharm IDE
1236    return res
1237
1238
1239def cross_patch_refit_y_aware_cols(
1240    *, x: pandas.DataFrame, y, res: pandas.DataFrame, plan: TreatmentPlan, cross_plan
1241) -> None:
1242    """
1243    Re fit the y-aware columns according to cross plan.
1244    Clears out refitter_ values to None.
1245    Assumes each y-aware variable produces one derived column.
1246
1247    :param x: explanatory values
1248    :param y: dependent values
1249    :param res: transformed frame to patch results into, altered
1250    :param plan: fitting plan
1251    :param cross_plan: cross validation plan
1252    :return: no return, res is altered in place
1253    """
1254
1255    if cross_plan is None or len(cross_plan) <= 1:
1256        for xf in plan.xforms:
1257            xf.refitter_ = None
1258        return
1259    incoming_colset = set(x.columns)
1260    derived_colset = set(res.columns)
1261    for xf in plan.xforms:
1262        if not xf.need_cross_treatment_:
1263            continue
1264        incoming_column_name = xf.incoming_column_name_
1265        derived_column_name = xf.derived_column_names_[0]
1266        if derived_column_name not in derived_colset:
1267            continue
1268        if incoming_column_name not in incoming_colset:
1269            raise KeyError("missing required column " + incoming_column_name)
1270        if xf.refitter_ is None:
1271            raise ValueError(
1272                "refitter is None: "
1273                + incoming_column_name
1274                + " -> "
1275                + derived_column_name
1276            )
1277
1278        # noinspection PyPep8Naming
1279        def maybe_transform(*, fit, X):
1280            """conditional patching"""
1281            if fit is None:
1282                return None
1283            return fit.transform(X)
1284
1285        patches = [
1286            maybe_transform(
1287                fit=xf.refitter_(
1288                    incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
1289                    x=x[incoming_column_name][cp["train"]],
1290                    y=y[cp["train"]],
1291                    extra_args=xf.extra_args_,
1292                    params=xf.params_,
1293                ),
1294                X=x.loc[cp["app"], [incoming_column_name]],
1295            )
1296            for cp in cross_plan
1297        ]
1298        # replace any missing sections with global average (slight data leak potential)
1299        avg = _mean_of_single_column_pandas_list(
1300            [pi for pi in patches if pi is not None]
1301        )
1302        if numpy.isnan(avg):
1303            avg = 0
1304        res[derived_column_name] = avg
1305        for i in range(len(cross_plan)):
1306            pi = patches[i]
1307            if pi is None:
1308                continue
1309            pi.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1310            cp = cross_plan[i]
1311            res.loc[cp["app"], derived_column_name] = numpy.asarray(
1312                pi[derived_column_name]
1313            ).reshape((len(pi),))
1314        res.loc[vtreat.util.is_bad(res[derived_column_name]), derived_column_name] = avg
1315    for xf in plan.xforms:
1316        xf.refitter_ = None
1317
1318
1319def cross_patch_user_y_aware_cols(
1320    *, x: pandas.DataFrame, y, res: pandas.DataFrame, params: Dict[str, Any], cross_plan
1321) -> None:
1322    """
1323    Re fit the user y-aware columns according to cross plan.
1324    Assumes each y-aware variable produces one derived column.
1325
1326    :param x: explanatory values
1327    :param y: dependent values
1328    :param res: transformed frame to patch results into, altered
1329    :param params: control parameter dictionary
1330    :param cross_plan: cross validation plan
1331    :return: no return, res altered in place
1332    """
1333    if cross_plan is None or len(cross_plan) <= 1:
1334        return
1335    incoming_colset = set(x.columns)
1336    derived_colset = set(res.columns)
1337    if len(derived_colset) <= 0:
1338        return
1339    for ut in params["user_transforms"]:
1340        if not ut.y_aware_:
1341            continue
1342        instersect_in = incoming_colset.intersection(set(ut.incoming_vars_))
1343        instersect_out = derived_colset.intersection(set(ut.derived_vars_))
1344        if len(instersect_out) <= 0:
1345            continue
1346        if len(instersect_out) != len(ut.derived_vars_):
1347            raise ValueError("not all derived columns are in res frame")
1348        if len(instersect_in) != len(ut.incoming_vars_):
1349            raise KeyError("missing required columns")
1350        patches = [
1351            ut.fit(X=x.loc[cp["train"], ut.incoming_vars_], y=y[cp["train"]]).transform(
1352                X=x.loc[cp["app"], ut.incoming_vars_]
1353            )
1354            for cp in cross_plan
1355        ]
1356        for col in ut.derived_vars_:
1357            # replace any missing sections with global average (slight data leak potential)
1358            avg = _mean_of_single_column_pandas_list(
1359                [pi.loc[:, [col]] for pi in patches if pi is not None]
1360            )
1361            if numpy.isnan(avg):
1362                avg = 0
1363            res[col] = avg
1364            for i in range(len(cross_plan)):
1365                pi = patches[i]
1366                if pi is None:
1367                    continue
1368                pi.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1369                cp = cross_plan[i]
1370                res.loc[cp["app"], col] = numpy.asarray(pi[col]).reshape((len(pi),))
1371            res.loc[vtreat.util.is_bad(res[col]), col] = avg
1372
1373
1374def score_plan_variables(
1375    cross_frame: pandas.DataFrame,
1376    outcome,
1377    plan: TreatmentPlan,
1378    params: Dict[str, Any],
1379    *,
1380    is_classification: bool = False,
1381) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1382    """
1383    Quality score variables to build up score frame.
1384
1385    :param cross_frame: cross transformed explanatory variables
1386    :param outcome: dependent variable
1387    :param plan: treatment plan
1388    :param params: control parameter dictionary
1389    :param is_classification: logical, if True classification if False regression
1390    :return: score frame
1391    """
1392
1393    def describe_xf(xf):
1394        """describe variable transform"""
1395        description = pandas.DataFrame({"variable": xf.derived_column_names_})
1396        description["orig_variable"] = xf.incoming_column_name_
1397        description["treatment"] = xf.treatment_
1398        description["y_aware"] = xf.need_cross_treatment_
1399        return description
1400
1401    def describe_ut(ut):
1402        """describe user variable transform"""
1403        description = pandas.DataFrame(
1404            {"orig_variable": ut.incoming_vars_, "variable": ut.derived_vars_}
1405        )
1406        description["treatment"] = ut.treatment_
1407        description["y_aware"] = ut.y_aware_
1408        return description
1409
1410    var_table = pandas.concat(
1411        [describe_xf(xf) for xf in plan.xforms]
1412        + [
1413            describe_ut(ut)
1414            for ut in params["user_transforms"]
1415            if len(ut.incoming_vars_) > 0
1416        ],
1417        sort=False,
1418    )
1419    var_table.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1420    sf = vtreat.util.score_variables(
1421        cross_frame,
1422        variables=var_table["variable"],
1423        outcome=outcome,
1424        is_classification=is_classification,
1425    )
1426    score_frame = pandas.merge(var_table, sf, how="left", on=["variable"], sort=False)
1427    num_treatment_types = len(score_frame["treatment"].unique())
1428    score_frame["_one"] = 1.0
1429    score_frame["vcount"] = score_frame.groupby("treatment")["_one"].transform("sum")
1430    score_frame["default_threshold"] = 1.0 / (
1431        score_frame["vcount"] * num_treatment_types
1432    )
1433    score_frame.drop(["_one"], axis=1, inplace=True)
1434    score_frame["recommended"] = numpy.logical_and(
1435        score_frame["has_range"],
1436        numpy.logical_and(
1437            numpy.logical_not(
1438                numpy.logical_or(
1439                    numpy.isnan(score_frame["significance"]),
1440                    numpy.isnan(score_frame["PearsonR"]),
1441                )
1442            ),
1443            numpy.logical_and(
1444                score_frame["significance"] < score_frame["default_threshold"],
1445                numpy.logical_or(
1446                    score_frame["PearsonR"] > 0.0,
1447                    numpy.logical_not(score_frame["y_aware"]),
1448                ),
1449            ),
1450        ),
1451    )
1452    return score_frame
1453
1454
1455def pseudo_score_plan_variables(
1456    *, cross_frame, plan: TreatmentPlan, params: Dict[str, Any]
1457) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1458    """
1459    Build a score frame look-alike for unsupervised case.
1460
1461    :param cross_frame: cross transformed explanatory variables
1462    :param plan: treatment plan
1463    :param params: control parameter dictionary
1464    :return: score frame
1465    """
1466
1467    def describe_xf(xf):
1468        """describe variable transform"""
1469        description = pandas.DataFrame({"variable": xf.derived_column_names_})
1470        description["orig_variable"] = xf.incoming_column_name_
1471        description["treatment"] = xf.treatment_
1472        description["y_aware"] = xf.need_cross_treatment_
1473        return description
1474
1475    def describe_ut(ut):
1476        """describe user variable transform"""
1477        description = pandas.DataFrame(
1478            {"orig_variable": ut.incoming_vars_, "variable": ut.derived_vars_}
1479        )
1480        description["treatment"] = ut.treatment_
1481        description["y_aware"] = ut.y_aware_
1482        return description
1483
1484    score_frame = pandas.concat(
1485        [describe_xf(xf) for xf in plan.xforms]
1486        + [
1487            describe_ut(ut)
1488            for ut in params["user_transforms"]
1489            if len(ut.incoming_vars_) > 0
1490        ],
1491        sort=False,
1492    )
1493    score_frame.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1494
1495    score_frame["has_range"] = [
1496        vtreat.util.numeric_has_range(cross_frame[c]) for c in score_frame["variable"]
1497    ]
1498    score_frame["PearsonR"] = numpy.nan
1499    score_frame["significance"] = numpy.nan
1500    score_frame["recommended"] = score_frame["has_range"].copy()
1501    score_frame["_one"] = 1.0
1502    score_frame["vcount"] = score_frame.groupby("treatment")["_one"].transform("sum")
1503    score_frame.drop(["_one"], axis=1, inplace=True)
1504    return score_frame
1505
1506
1507class VariableTreatment(
1508    abc.ABC, sklearn.base.BaseEstimator, sklearn.base.TransformerMixin
1509):
1510    """
1511    Class for variable treatments, implements much of the sklearn pipeline/transformer
1512    API. https://sklearn-template.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user_guide.html#transformer
1513    """
1514
1515    result_restriction: Optional[Set[str]]
1516    outcome_name_: Optional[str]
1517    outcome_target_: Optional[Any]
1518    var_list_: List[str]
1519    cols_to_copy_: List[str]
1520    params_: Dict[str, Any]
1521    plan_: Optional[TreatmentPlan]
1522    score_frame_: Optional[pandas.DataFrame]
1523    imputation_map_: Dict[str, Callable]
1524    last_fit_x_id_: Optional[str]
1525    cross_plan_: Optional[List[Dict[str, List[int]]]]
1526    cross_rows_: Optional[int]
1527    last_result_columns: Optional[List[str]]
1528
1529    def __init__(
1530        self,
1531        *,
1532        var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
1533        outcome_name: Optional[str] = None,
1534        outcome_target: Optional[Any] = None,
1535        cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
1536        params: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
1537        imputation_map: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
1538    ):
1539        """
1540
1541        :param var_list: variables we intend to encode, empty means all
1542        :param outcome_name: column name of outcome
1543        :param outcome_target: outcome column value we consider in class or True
1544        :param cols_to_copy: columns to not process, but copy over
1545        :param params: control and configuration parameters
1546        :param imputation_map: per column imputation strategies or values
1547        """
1548        if var_list is None:
1549            var_list = []
1550        else:
1551            var_list = vtreat.util.unique_items_in_order(var_list)
1552        if cols_to_copy is None:
1553            cols_to_copy = []
1554        else:
1555            cols_to_copy = vtreat.util.unique_items_in_order(cols_to_copy)
1556        if (outcome_name is not None) and (outcome_name not in set(cols_to_copy)):
1557            cols_to_copy.append(outcome_name)
1558        confused = set(cols_to_copy).intersection(set(var_list))
1559        if len(confused) > 0:
1560            raise ValueError(
1561                "variables in treatment plan and non-treatment: " + ", ".join(confused)
1562            )
1563        if imputation_map is None:
1564            imputation_map = dict()
1565        self.outcome_name_ = outcome_name
1566        self.outcome_target_ = outcome_target
1567        self.var_list_ = [vi for vi in var_list if vi not in set(cols_to_copy)]
1568        self.cols_to_copy_ = cols_to_copy
1569        if params is not None:
1570            self.params_ = params.copy()
1571        else:
1572            self.params_ = dict()
1573        self.imputation_map_ = imputation_map.copy()
1574        self.plan_ = None
1575        self.score_frame_ = None
1576        self.cross_rows_ = None
1577        self.cross_plan_ = None
1578        self.last_fit_x_id_ = None
1579        self.last_result_columns = None
1580        self.result_restriction = None
1581        self.clear()
1582
1583    def check_column_names(self, col_names: Iterable[str]) -> None:
1584        """
1585        Check that none of the column names we are working with are non-unique.
1586        Also check variable columns are all present (columns to copy and outcome allowed to be missing).
1587
1588        :param col_names:
1589        :return: None, raises exception if there is a problem
1590        """
1591
1592        col_names = [c for c in col_names]
1593        to_check = set(self.var_list_)
1594        if self.outcome_name_ is not None:
1595            to_check.add(self.outcome_name_)
1596        if self.cols_to_copy_ is not None:
1597            to_check.update(self.cols_to_copy_)
1598        seen = [c for c in col_names if c in to_check]
1599        if len(seen) != len(set(seen)):
1600            raise ValueError("duplicate column names in frame")
1601        missing = set(self.var_list_) - set(col_names)
1602        if len(missing) > 0:
1603            raise ValueError(f"missing required columns: {missing}")
1604
1605    def clear(self) -> None:
1606        """reset state"""
1607        self.plan_ = None
1608        self.score_frame_ = None
1609        self.cross_rows_ = None
1610        self.cross_plan_ = None
1611        self.last_fit_x_id_ = None
1612        self.last_result_columns = None
1613        self.result_restriction = None
1614
1615    def get_result_restriction(self):
1616        """accessor"""
1617        if self.result_restriction is None:
1618            return None
1619        return self.result_restriction.copy()
1620
1621    def set_result_restriction(self, new_vars) -> None:
1622        """setter"""
1623        self.result_restriction = None
1624        if (new_vars is not None) and (len(new_vars) > 0):
1625            self.result_restriction = set(new_vars)
1626
1627    @abc.abstractmethod
1628    def merge_params(self, p: Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
1629        """merge in use parameters"""
1630
1631    # sklearn pipeline step methods
1632
1633    # https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.base.TransformerMixin.html
1634
1635    # noinspection PyPep8Naming, PyUnusedLocal
1636    def fit(self, X, y=None, **fit_params):
1637        """
1638        sklearn fit.
1639
1640        :param X: explanatory variables
1641        :param y: (optional) dependent variable
1642        :param fit_params:
1643        :return: self (for method chaining)
1644        """
1645
1646        self.fit_transform(X=X, y=y)
1647        return self
1648
1649    # noinspection PyPep8Naming, PyUnusedLocal
1650    @abc.abstractmethod
1651    def fit_transform(self, X, y=None, **fit_params):
1652        """
1653        sklearn fit_transform, correct way to trigger cross methods.
1654
1655        :param X: explanatory variables
1656        :param y: (optional) dependent variable
1657        :param fit_params:
1658        :return: transformed data
1659        """
1660
1661    # noinspection PyPep8Naming
1662    @abc.abstractmethod
1663    def transform(self, X):
1664        """
1665        sklearn transform
1666
1667        :param X: explanatory variables
1668        :return: transformed data
1669        """
1670
1671    # https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.base.BaseEstimator.html
1672
1673    # noinspection PyUnusedLocal,PyMethodMayBeStatic
1674    def get_params(self, deep=True):
1675        """
1676        vtreat exposes a subset of controls as tunable parameters, users can choose this set
1677        by specifying the tunable_params list in object construction parameters
1678
1679        :param deep: ignored
1680        :return: dict of tunable parameters
1681        """
1682        return {ti: self.params_[ti] for ti in self.params_["tunable_params"]}
1683
1684    # noinspection PyUnusedLocal,PyMethodMayBeStatic
1685    def set_params(self, **params):
1686        """
1687        vtreat exposes a subset of controls as tunable parameters, users can choose this set
1688        by specifying the tunable_params list in object construction parameters
1689
1690        :param params:
1691        :return: self (for method chaining)
1692        """
1693
1694        for k, v in params.items():
1695            if k in self.params_["tunable_params"]:
1696                self.params_[k] = v
1697        return self
1698
1699    # extra methods to look more like sklearn objects
1700
1701    # https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.pipeline.Pipeline.html
1702
1703    # noinspection PyPep8Naming
1704    def fit_predict(self, X, y=None, **fit_params):
1705        """
1706        Alias for fit_transform()
1707
1708        :param X: explanatory variables
1709        :param y: (optional) dependent variable
1710        :param fit_params:
1711        :return: transformed data
1712        """
1713        return self.fit_transform(X=X, y=y, **fit_params)
1714
1715    # noinspection PyPep8Naming
1716    def predict(self, X):
1717        """
1718        Alias for transform.
1719
1720        :param X: explanatory variables
1721        :return: transformed data
1722        """
1723
1724        return self.transform(X)
1725
1726    # noinspection PyPep8Naming
1727    def predict_proba(self, X):
1728        """
1729        Alias for transform.
1730
1731        :param X: explanatory variables
1732        :return: transformed data
1733        """
1734
1735        return self.transform(X)
1736
1737    # https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/blob/master/sklearn/compose/_column_transformer.py
1738
1739    def get_feature_names(self, input_features=None):
1740        """
1741        Get list of produced feature names.
1742
1743        :param input_features: Optional, restrict to these features
1744        :return:
1745        """
1746        if self.score_frame_ is None:
1747            raise ValueError(
1748                "get_feature_names called on uninitialized vtreat transform"
1749            )
1750        if input_features is not None:
1751            input_features = [c for c in input_features]
1752        filter_to_recommended = False
1753        try:
1754            filter_to_recommended = self.params_["filter_to_recommended"]
1755        except KeyError:
1756            pass
1757        if filter_to_recommended:
1758            new_vars = [
1759                self.score_frame_["variable"][i]
1760                for i in range(self.score_frame_.shape[0])
1761                if self.score_frame_["has_range"][i]
1762                and self.score_frame_["recommended"][i]
1763                and (
1764                    input_features is None
1765                    or self.score_frame_["orig_variable"][i] in input_features
1766                )
1767            ]
1768        else:
1769            new_vars = [
1770                self.score_frame_["variable"][i]
1771                for i in range(self.score_frame_.shape[0])
1772                if self.score_frame_["has_range"][i]
1773                and (
1774                    input_features is None
1775                    or self.score_frame_["orig_variable"][i] in input_features
1776                )
1777            ]
1778        new_vars = new_vars + self.cols_to_copy_
1779        return new_vars
1780
1781    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1782        """
1783        Return description of transform as a data frame. Does not encode user steps. Not yet implemented for
1784        multinomial dependent variables.
1785
1786        :return: description of transform.
1787        """
1788
1789        assert self.plan_ is not None  # type hint
1790        assert self.score_frame_ is not None  # type hint
1791        xform_steps = [xfi for xfi in self.plan_.xforms]
1792        frames = [xfi.description_matrix() for xfi in xform_steps]
1793        res = pandas.concat(frames).reset_index(inplace=False, drop=True)
1794        # restrict down to non-constant variables
1795        scored_vars = set(self.score_frame_["variable"][self.score_frame_["has_range"]])
1796        usable = [v in scored_vars for v in res["variable"]]
1797        res = res.loc[usable, :].reset_index(inplace=False, drop=True)
1798        return res
1799
1800
1801def perform_transform(
1802    *, x: pandas.DataFrame, transform: VariableTreatment, params: Dict[str, Any]
1803) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1804    """
1805    Transform a data frame.
1806
1807    :param x: data to be transformed.
1808    :param transform: transform
1809    :param params: control parameter dictionary
1810    :return: new data frame
1811    """
1812    assert transform.plan_ is not None  # type hint
1813    xform_steps = [xfi for xfi in transform.plan_.xforms]
1814    user_steps = [stp for stp in params["user_transforms"]]
1815    # restrict down to to results we are going to use
1816    if (transform.result_restriction is not None) and (
1817        len(transform.result_restriction) > 0
1818    ):
1819        xform_steps = [
1820            xfi
1821            for xfi in xform_steps
1822            if len(
1823                set(xfi.derived_column_names_).intersection(
1824                    transform.result_restriction
1825                )
1826            )
1827            > 0
1828        ]
1829        user_steps = [
1830            stp
1831            for stp in user_steps
1832            if len(set(stp.derived_vars_).intersection(transform.result_restriction))
1833            > 0
1834        ]
1835    # check all required columns are present
1836    needs = set()
1837    for xfi in xform_steps:
1838        if xfi.incoming_column_name_ is not None:
1839            needs.add(xfi.incoming_column_name_)
1840    for stp in user_steps:
1841        if stp.incoming_vars_ is not None:
1842            needs.update(stp.incoming_vars_)
1843    missing = needs - set(x.columns)
1844    if len(missing) > 0:
1845        raise ValueError("missing required input columns " + str(missing))
1846    # do the work
1847    new_frames = [xfi.transform(x) for xfi in (xform_steps + user_steps)]
1848    new_frames = [frm for frm in new_frames if (frm is not None) and (frm.shape[1] > 0)]
1849    # see if we want to copy over any columns
1850    copy_set = set(transform.plan_.cols_to_copy)
1851    to_copy = [ci for ci in x.columns if ci in copy_set]
1852    if len(to_copy) > 0:
1853        cp = x.loc[:, to_copy].copy()
1854        new_frames = [cp] + new_frames
1855    if len(new_frames) <= 0:
1856        raise ValueError("no columns transformed")
1857    res = pandas.concat(new_frames, axis=1, sort=False)
1858    res.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1859    return res
1860
1861
1862def limit_to_appropriate_columns(
1863    *, res: pandas.DataFrame, transform: VariableTreatment
1864) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1865    """
1866    Limit down to appropriate columns.
1867
1868    :param res:
1869    :param transform:
1870    :return:
1871    """
1872    assert transform.plan_ is not None  # type hint
1873    assert transform.score_frame_ is not None  # type hint
1874    to_copy = set(transform.plan_.cols_to_copy)
1875    to_take = set(
1876        [
1877            ci
1878            for ci in transform.score_frame_["variable"][
1879                transform.score_frame_["has_range"]
1880            ]
1881        ]
1882    )
1883    if (transform.result_restriction is not None) and (
1884        len(transform.result_restriction) > 0
1885    ):
1886        to_take = to_take.intersection(transform.result_restriction)
1887    cols_to_keep = [ci for ci in res.columns if (ci in to_copy) or (ci in to_take)]
1888    if len(cols_to_keep) <= 0:
1889        raise ValueError("no columns retained")
1890    res = res[cols_to_keep].copy()
1891    res.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1892    return res
bad_sentinel = '_NA_'
def replace_bad_with_sentinel(ar: List) -> numpy.ndarray: 
24def replace_bad_with_sentinel(ar: List) -> numpy.ndarray:
25    """
26    Replace None/NaN entries in iterable with '_NA_'
27    :param ar: iterable
28    :return: one dimensional numpy array
29    """
30
31    ar = numpy.array(ar)
32    bads = pandas.isnull(ar)
33    ar[bads] = bad_sentinel
34    return ar

Replace None/NaN entries in iterable with '_NA_'

  • ar: iterable

def ready_data_frame(d) -> Tuple[pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, type]: 
37def ready_data_frame(d) -> Tuple[pandas.DataFrame, type]:
38    """
39    Convert an array-like object to a data frame for processing.
40
41    :param d: data frame like object to work with
42    :return: dataframe with string-named columns
43    """
44    orig_type = type(d)
45    if not isinstance(d, pandas.DataFrame):
46        d = pandas.DataFrame(d)
47    else:
48        d = d.copy()
49    d.columns = [str(c) for c in d.columns]  # convert column names to strings
50    return d, orig_type

Convert an array-like object to a data frame for processing.

Parameters
  • d: data frame like object to work with
Returns

dataframe with string-named columns

def back_to_orig_type_data_frame(d: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, orig_type: type) -> Tuple[Any, List[str]]: 
53def back_to_orig_type_data_frame(
54    d: pandas.DataFrame, orig_type: type
55) -> Tuple[Any, List[str]]:
56    """
57    Convert data frame back to ndarray if that was the original type.
58
59    :param d: data frame
60    :param orig_type: type of original object
61    :return: converted result
62    """
63    if not isinstance(d, pandas.DataFrame):
64        raise TypeError(
65            "Expected result to be a pandas.DataFrame, found: " + str(type(d))
66        )
67    columns = [c for c in d.columns]
68    if orig_type == numpy.ndarray:
69        d = numpy.asarray(d)
70    return d, columns

Convert data frame back to ndarray if that was the original type.

  • orig_type: type of original object

 73class VarTransform(abc.ABC):
 74    """
 75    Base class for vtreat transforms
 76    """
 77
 78    incoming_column_name_: str
 79    incoming_column_is_numeric_: bool
 80    derived_column_names_: List[str]

 87    def __init__(
 88        self,
 89        *,
 90        incoming_column_name: str,
 91        incoming_column_is_numeric: bool,
 92        derived_column_names: Iterable[str],
 93        treatment: str,
 94    ):
 95        """
 96
 97        :param incoming_column_name:
 98        :param incoming_column_is_numeric:
 99        :param derived_column_names:
100        :param treatment:
101        """
102
103        assert isinstance(incoming_column_name, str)
104        assert isinstance(incoming_column_is_numeric, bool)
105        assert not isinstance(derived_column_names, str)
106        derived_column_names = list(derived_column_names)
107        assert len(derived_column_names) > 0
108        assert numpy.all([isinstance(dni, str) for dni in derived_column_names])
109        assert isinstance(treatment, str)
110        self.incoming_column_name_ = incoming_column_name

117        self.params_ = None

class TreatmentPlan: 
138class TreatmentPlan:
139    """
140    Class to carry treatment plans.
141    """
142
143    outcome_name: Optional[str]
144    cols_to_copy: Tuple[str, ...]
145    num_list: Tuple[str, ...]
146    cat_list: Tuple[str, ...]
147    xforms: Tuple[VarTransform, ...]
148
149    def __init__(
150        self,
151        *,
152        outcome_name: Optional[str] = None,
153        cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
154        num_list: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
155        cat_list: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
156        xforms: Iterable[Optional[VarTransform]],
157    ):
158        self.outcome_name = outcome_name
159        if cols_to_copy is None:
160            self.cols_to_copy = tuple()
161        else:
162            assert not isinstance(cols_to_copy, str)
163            self.cols_to_copy = tuple(cols_to_copy)
164        if num_list is None:
165            self.num_list = tuple()
166        else:
167            assert not isinstance(num_list, str)
168            self.num_list = tuple(num_list)
169        if cat_list is None:
170            self.cat_list = tuple()
171        else:
172            assert not isinstance(cat_list, str)
173            self.cat_list = tuple(cat_list)
174        non_empty_xforms: List[VarTransform] = [x for x in xforms if x is not None]
175        self.xforms = tuple(non_empty_xforms)
176        for c in self.cols_to_copy:
177            assert isinstance(c, str)
178        for c in self.num_list:
179            assert isinstance(c, str)
180        for c in self.cat_list:
181            assert isinstance(c, str)
182        if len(self.xforms) < 1:
183            raise ValueError("no treatments generated")
184        for x in self.xforms:
185            assert isinstance(x, VarTransform)

class MappedCodeTransform(VarTransform): 
188class MappedCodeTransform(VarTransform):
189    """Class for transforms that are a dictionary mapping of strings to numeric values"""
190
191    def __init__(
192        self,
193        *,
194        incoming_column_name: str,
195        derived_column_name: str,
196        treatment: str,
197        code_book: pandas.DataFrame,
198    ):
199        """
200
201        :param incoming_column_name:
202        :param derived_column_name:
203        :param treatment:
204        :param code_book: Pandas dataframe mapping values to impact codes
205        """
206
207        VarTransform.__init__(
208            self,
209            incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
210            incoming_column_is_numeric=False,
211            derived_column_names=[derived_column_name],
212            treatment=treatment,
213        )
214        self.code_book_ = code_book
215
216    def transform(self, data_frame: pandas.DataFrame) -> pandas.DataFrame:
217        """
218        return a transformed data frame
219
220        :rtype: pandas.DataFrame
221        :param data_frame: incoming values
222        :return: transformed values
223        """
224
225        incoming_column_name = self.incoming_column_name_
226        derived_column_name = self.derived_column_names_[0]
227        sf = pandas.DataFrame({incoming_column_name: data_frame[incoming_column_name]})
228        bad_posns = vtreat.util.is_bad(sf[incoming_column_name])
229        sf.loc[bad_posns, incoming_column_name] = bad_sentinel
230        res = pandas.merge(
231            sf, self.code_book_, on=[self.incoming_column_name_], how="left", sort=False
232        )  # ordered by left table rows
233        # could also try pandas .map()
234        res = res[[derived_column_name]].copy()
235        res.loc[vtreat.util.is_bad(res[derived_column_name]), derived_column_name] = 0.0
236        return res
237
238    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
239        """
240        Return description of transform as a data frame.
241
242        :return: description of transform.
243        """
244
245        description = pandas.DataFrame(
246            {
247                "treatment_class": "MappedCodeTransform",
248                "treatment": self.treatment_,
249                "orig_var": self.incoming_column_name_,
250                "orig_was_numeric": self.incoming_column_is_numeric_,
251                "variable": self.derived_column_names_[0],
252                "value": replace_bad_with_sentinel(
253                    self.code_book_[self.incoming_column_name_]
254                ),
255                "replacement": self.code_book_[self.derived_column_names_[0]].copy(),
256            }
257        )
258        return description

def fit_clean_code( *, incoming_column_name: str, x, params: Dict[str, Any], imputation_map: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[VarTransform]: 
410def fit_clean_code(
411    *,
412    incoming_column_name: str,
413    x,
414    params: Dict[str, Any],
415    imputation_map: Dict[str, Any],
416) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
417    """
418    Fit numeric clean column imputation transform
419
420    :param incoming_column_name: name of column
421    :param x: training values for column
422    :param params: control parameter dictionary
423    :param imputation_map: per-column map to imputation strategies or values
424    :return: transform
425    """
426
427    if not vtreat.util.numeric_has_range(x):
428        return None
429    replacement = params["missingness_imputation"]
430    try:
431        replacement = imputation_map[incoming_column_name]
432    except KeyError:
433        pass
434    if vtreat.util.can_convert_v_to_numeric(replacement):
435        replacement_value = 0.0 + replacement
436    elif callable(replacement):
437        replacement_value = vtreat.util.summarize_column(x, fn=replacement)
438    else:
439        raise TypeError(
440            "unexpected imputation type "
441            + str(type(replacement))
442            + " ("
443            + incoming_column_name
444            + ")"
445        )
446    if (
447        pandas.isnull(replacement_value)
448        or math.isnan(replacement_value)
449        or math.isinf(replacement_value)
450    ):
451        raise ValueError(
452            "replacement was bad "
453            + incoming_column_name
454            + ": "
455            + str(replacement_value)
456        )
457    return CleanNumericTransform(
458        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name, replacement_value=replacement_value
459    )
