def fit_regression_impact_code( *, incoming_column_name: str, x, y, extra_args: Optional[Dict[str, Any]], params: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[VarTransform]: 
462def fit_regression_impact_code(
463    *,
464    incoming_column_name: str,
465    x,
466    y,
467    extra_args: Optional[Dict[str, Any]],
468    params: Dict[str, Any],
469) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
470    """
471    Fit regression impact code transform
472
473    :param incoming_column_name:
474    :param x: training explanatory values
475    :param y: training dependent values
476    :param extra_args: optional extra arguments for fit_ methods
477    :param params: control parameter dictionary
478    :return:
479    """
480
481    if (len(x) <= 1) or (len(set(x)) <= 1):
482        return None
483    if params["use_hierarchical_estimate"]:
484        cf = vtreat.util.pooled_impact_estimate(x, y)
485        cf["_impact_code"] = cf["estimate"] - cf["grand_mean"]
486    else:
487        cf = vtreat.util.grouped_by_x_statistics(x, y)
488        cf["_impact_code"] = cf["_group_mean"] - cf["_gm"]
489    if cf.shape[0] <= 1:

500        extra_args=extra_args,
501        params=params,
502    )

505def fit_regression_deviation_code(
506    *,
507    incoming_column_name: str,
508    x,
509    y,
510    extra_args: Optional[Dict[str, Any]],
511    params: Dict[str, Any],
512) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
513    """
514    Fit regression deviation code transform
515
516    :param incoming_column_name:
517    :param x: training explanatory values
518    :param y: training dependent values
519    :param extra_args: optional extra arguments for fit_ methods
520    :param params: control parameter dictionary
521    :return:
522    """

524    if (len(x) <= 1) or (len(set(x)) <= 1):
525        return None

def fit_binomial_impact_code( *, incoming_column_name: str, x, y, extra_args: Dict[str, Any], params: Dict[str, Any]) -> Optional[VarTransform]: 
544def fit_binomial_impact_code(
545    *,
546    incoming_column_name: str,
547    x,
548    y,
549    extra_args: Dict[str, Any],
550    params: Dict[str, Any],
551) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
552    """
553    Fit categorical impact code.
554
555    :param incoming_column_name:
556    :param x: training explanatory values
557    :param y: training dependent values
558    :param extra_args: required extra arguments for fit_ methods
559    :param params: control parameter dictionary
560    :return:
561    """
562    if (len(x) <= 1) or (len(set(x)) <= 1):
563        return None
564    outcome_target = (
565        extra_args["outcome_target"],
566    )  # TODO: document why this is a tuple
567    var_suffix = extra_args["var_suffix"]
568    y = numpy.asarray(numpy.asarray(y) == outcome_target, dtype=float)
569    eps = 1.0e-3
570    if params["use_hierarchical_estimate"]:
571        cf = vtreat.util.pooled_impact_estimate(x, y)
572        cf["_logit_code"] = numpy.log(
573            (numpy.maximum(cf["estimate"], 0.0) + eps)
574            / (numpy.maximum(cf["grand_mean"], 0.0) + eps)
575        )
576    else:
577        cf = vtreat.util.grouped_by_x_statistics(x, y)
578        cf["_logit_code"] = numpy.log(
579            (numpy.maximum(cf["_group_mean"], 0.0) + eps)
580            / (numpy.maximum(cf["_gm"], 0.0) + eps)
581        )
582    if cf.shape[0] <= 1:
583        return None
584    sf = cf.loc[:, ["x", "_logit_code"]].reset_index(drop=True, inplace=False)
585    newcol = incoming_column_name + "_logit_code" + var_suffix
586    sf.columns = [incoming_column_name, newcol]
587    return YAwareMappedCodeTransform(
588        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
589        derived_column_name=newcol,
590        treatment="logit_code",
591        code_book=sf,
592        refitter=fit_binomial_impact_code,
593        extra_args=extra_args,
594        params=params,
595    )

class IndicatorCodeTransform(VarTransform): 
598class IndicatorCodeTransform(VarTransform):
599    """Class for indicator codes"""
600
601    def __init__(
602        self,
603        *,
604        incoming_column_name: str,
605        derived_column_names: List[str],
606        levels: List,
607        sparse_indicators: bool = False,
608    ):
609        """
610
611        :param incoming_column_name:
612        :param derived_column_names:
613        :param levels: leves we are encoding to indicators
614        :param sparse_indicators: if True use sparse data structure
615        """
616        VarTransform.__init__(
617            self,
618            incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
619            incoming_column_is_numeric=False,
620            derived_column_names=derived_column_names,
621            treatment="indicator_code",
622        )
623        self.levels_ = levels
624        self.sparse_indicators_ = sparse_indicators
625
626    def transform(self, data_frame):
627        """
628        return a transformed data frame
629
630        :rtype: pandas.DataFrame
631        :param data_frame: incoming values
632        :return: transformed values
633        """
634
635        incoming_column_name = self.incoming_column_name_
636        sf = pandas.DataFrame({incoming_column_name: data_frame[incoming_column_name]})
637        bad_posns = vtreat.util.is_bad(sf[incoming_column_name])
638        sf.loc[bad_posns, incoming_column_name] = bad_sentinel
639        col = sf[self.incoming_column_name_]
640
641        def f(i: int):
642            """transform one column"""
643            v = numpy.asarray(col == self.levels_[i]) + 0.0  # return numeric 0/1 coding
644            if self.sparse_indicators_:
645                v = pandas.arrays.SparseArray(v, fill_value=0.0)
646            return v
647
648        res = None
649        for ii in range(len(self.levels_)):
650            if res is None:
651                res = pandas.DataFrame({self.derived_column_names_[ii]: f(ii)})
652            else:
653                res[self.derived_column_names_[ii]] = f(ii)
654        return res
655
656    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
657        """
658        Return description of transform as a data frame.
659
660        :return: description of transform.
661        """
662
663        description = pandas.DataFrame(
664            {
665                "treatment_class": "IndicatorCodeTransform",
666                "treatment": self.treatment_,
667                "orig_var": self.incoming_column_name_,
668                "orig_was_numeric": self.incoming_column_is_numeric_,
669                "variable": self.derived_column_names_.copy(),
670                "value": replace_bad_with_sentinel(self.levels_),
671                "replacement": 1.0,
672            }
673        )
674        return description

def fit_indicator_code( *, incoming_column_name: str, x, min_fraction: float = 0.0, max_levels: Optional[int] = None, sparse_indicators: bool = False) -> Optional[VarTransform]: 
677def fit_indicator_code(
678    *,
679    incoming_column_name: str,
680    x,
681    min_fraction: float = 0.0,
682    max_levels: Optional[int] = None,
683    sparse_indicators: bool = False,
684) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
685    """
686    Fit indicator codes
687
688    :param incoming_column_name:
689    :param x: training explanatory variables
690    :param min_fraction:
691    :param max_levels:
692    :param sparse_indicators:
693    :return:
694    """
695
696    sf = pandas.DataFrame({incoming_column_name: x})
697    bad_posns = vtreat.util.is_bad(sf[incoming_column_name])
698    sf.loc[bad_posns, incoming_column_name] = bad_sentinel
699    counts = sf[incoming_column_name].value_counts()
700    n = sf.shape[0]
701    counts = counts[counts > 0]
702    counts = counts[counts >= min_fraction * n]  # no more than 1/min_fraction symbols
703    levels = [str(v) for v in counts.index]
704    if (max_levels is not None) and (len(levels) > max_levels):
705        level_frame = pandas.DataFrame({"levels": levels, "counts": counts})
706        level_frame.sort_values(
707            by=["counts", "levels"],
708            ascending=[False, True],
709            inplace=True,
710            axis=0,
711            ignore_index=True,
712        )
713        value_vec = level_frame["levels"].values
714        levels = [value_vec[i] for i in range(max_levels)]
715    if len(levels) < 1:
716        return None
717    return IndicatorCodeTransform(
718        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
719        derived_column_names=vtreat.util.build_level_codes(
720            incoming_column_name, levels
721        ),
722        levels=levels,
723        sparse_indicators=sparse_indicators,
724    )

  • x: training explanatory variables

  • max_levels:
  • sparse_indicators:

def fit_prevalence_code( incoming_column_name: str, x) -> Optional[VarTransform]: 
727def fit_prevalence_code(incoming_column_name: str, x) -> Optional[VarTransform]:
728    """
729    Fit a prevalence code
730
731    :param incoming_column_name:
732    :param x: training explanatory values
733    :return:
734    """
735
736    sf = pandas.DataFrame({"x": x})
737    bad_posns = vtreat.util.is_bad(sf["x"])
738    sf.loc[bad_posns, "x"] = bad_sentinel
739    sf.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
740    n = sf.shape[0]
741    sf["_ni"] = 1.0
742    sf = pandas.DataFrame(sf.groupby("x")["_ni"].sum())
743    sf.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=False)
744    sf["_prev"] = sf["_ni"] / n
745    sf = sf.loc[:, ["x", "_prev"]].copy()
746    newcol = incoming_column_name + "_prevalence_code"
747    sf.columns = [incoming_column_name, newcol]
748    sf[incoming_column_name] = sf[incoming_column_name].astype(str)
749    sf.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
750    return MappedCodeTransform(
751        incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
752        derived_column_name=newcol,
753        treatment="prevalence_code",
754        code_book=sf,
755    )

  • x: training explanatory values

def fit_numeric_outcome_treatment( *, X, y, var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]], outcome_name: str, cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]], params: Dict[str, Any], imputation_map: Dict[str, Any]) -> TreatmentPlan: 
814def fit_numeric_outcome_treatment(
815    *,
816    X,
817    y,
818    var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]],
819    outcome_name: str,
820    cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]],
821    params: Dict[str, Any],
822    imputation_map: Dict[str, Any],
823) -> TreatmentPlan:
824    """
825    Fit set of treatments in a regression situation.
826
827    :param X: training explanatory values
828    :param y: training dependent values
829    :param var_list: list of dependent variable names, if empty all non outcome and copy columns are used
830    :param outcome_name: name for outcome column
831    :param cols_to_copy: list of columns to copy to output
832    :param params: control parameter dictionary
833    :param imputation_map: per-column map to imputation strategies or values
834    :return: transform plan
835    """
836    cat_list, cols_to_copy, mis_list, num_list, var_list = _prepare_variable_lists(
837        X=X, cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy, var_list=var_list
838    )
839    xforms: List[Optional[VarTransform]] = []
840    if "missing_indicator" in params["coders"]:
841        num_set = set(num_list)
842        for vi in mis_list:
843            xforms.append(
844                IndicateMissingTransform(
845                    incoming_column_name=vi,
846                    incoming_column_is_numeric=vi in num_set,
847                    derived_column_name=vi + "_is_bad",
848                )
849            )
850    if "clean_copy" in params["coders"]:
851        for vi in num_list:
852            xform = fit_clean_code(
853                incoming_column_name=vi,
854                x=X[vi],
855                params=params,
856                imputation_map=imputation_map,
857            )
858            if xform is not None:
859                xforms.append(xform)
860    for vi in cat_list:
861        if "impact_code" in params["coders"]:
862            xforms.append(
863                fit_regression_impact_code(
864                    incoming_column_name=vi,
865                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
866                    y=y,
867                    extra_args=None,
868                    params=params,
869                )
870            )
871        if "deviation_code" in params["coders"]:
872            xforms.append(
873                fit_regression_deviation_code(
874                    incoming_column_name=vi,
875                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
876                    y=y,
877                    extra_args=None,
878                    params=params,
879                )
880            )
881        if "prevalence_code" in params["coders"]:
882            xforms.append(
883                fit_prevalence_code(incoming_column_name=vi, x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]))
884            )
885        if "indicator_code" in params["coders"]:
886            xforms.append(
887                fit_indicator_code(
888                    incoming_column_name=vi,
889                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
890                    min_fraction=params["indicator_min_fraction"],
891                    sparse_indicators=params["sparse_indicators"],
892                )
893            )
894    for stp in params["user_transforms"]:
895        stp.fit(X=X[var_list], y=y)
896    return TreatmentPlan(
897        outcome_name=outcome_name,
898        cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy,
899        num_list=num_list,
900        cat_list=cat_list,
901        xforms=xforms,
902    )

def fit_binomial_outcome_treatment( *, X, y, outcome_target, var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]], outcome_name: str, cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]], params: Dict[str, Any], imputation_map: Dict[str, Any]) -> TreatmentPlan: 
906def fit_binomial_outcome_treatment(
907    *,
908    X,
909    y,
910    outcome_target,
911    var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]],
912    outcome_name: str,
913    cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]],
914    params: Dict[str, Any],
915    imputation_map: Dict[str, Any],
916) -> TreatmentPlan:
917    """
918
919    :param X: training explanatory values
920    :param y: training dependent values
921    :param outcome_target: dependent value to consider positive or in class
922    :param var_list: list of variables to process, if empty all non outcome and copy columns are used
923    :param outcome_name: name for outcome column
924    :param cols_to_copy: list of columns to copy to output
925    :param params: control parameter dictionary
926    :param imputation_map: per-column map to imputation strategies or values
927    :return: transform plan
928    """
929    cat_list, cols_to_copy, mis_list, num_list, var_list = _prepare_variable_lists(
930        X=X, cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy, var_list=var_list
931    )
932    xforms: List[Optional[VarTransform]] = []
933    if "missing_indicator" in params["coders"]:
934        num_set = set(num_list)
935        for vi in mis_list:
936            xforms.append(
937                IndicateMissingTransform(
938                    incoming_column_name=vi,
939                    incoming_column_is_numeric=vi in num_set,
940                    derived_column_name=vi + "_is_bad",
941                )
942            )
943    if "clean_copy" in params["coders"]:
944        for vi in num_list:
945            xform = fit_clean_code(
946                incoming_column_name=vi,
947                x=X[vi],
948                params=params,
949                imputation_map=imputation_map,
950            )
951            if xform is not None:
952                xforms.append(xform)
953    extra_args = {"outcome_target": outcome_target, "var_suffix": ""}
954    for vi in cat_list:
955        if "logit_code" in params["coders"]:
956            xforms.append(
957                fit_binomial_impact_code(
958                    incoming_column_name=vi,
959                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
960                    y=y,
961                    extra_args=extra_args,
962                    params=params,
963                )
964            )
965        if "prevalence_code" in params["coders"]:
966            xforms.append(
967                fit_prevalence_code(incoming_column_name=vi, x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]))
968            )
969        if "indicator_code" in params["coders"]:
970            xforms.append(
971                fit_indicator_code(
972                    incoming_column_name=vi,
973                    x=numpy.asarray(X[vi]),
974                    min_fraction=params["indicator_min_fraction"],
975                    sparse_indicators=params["sparse_indicators"],
976                )
977            )
978    for stp in params["user_transforms"]:
979        stp.fit(X=X[var_list], y=y)
980    return TreatmentPlan(
981        outcome_name=outcome_name,
982        cols_to_copy=cols_to_copy,
983        num_list=num_list,
984        cat_list=cat_list,
985        xforms=xforms,
986    )

def pre_prep_frame( x: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, *, col_list: Optional[Iterable[str]], cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]], cat_cols: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
1151def pre_prep_frame(
1152    x: pandas.DataFrame,
1153    *,
1154    col_list: Optional[Iterable[str]],
1155    cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]],
1156    cat_cols: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
1157) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1158    """
1159    Create a copy of pandas.DataFrame x restricted to col_list union cols_to_copy with col_list - cols_to_copy
1160    converted to only string and numeric types.  New pandas.DataFrame has trivial indexing.  If col_list
1161    is empty it is interpreted as all columns.
1162
1163    :param x:
1164    :param col_list:
1165    :param cols_to_copy:
1166    :param cat_cols:
1167    :return:
1168    """
1169
1170    if cols_to_copy is None:
1171        cols_to_copy = []
1172    else:
1173        cols_to_copy = list(cols_to_copy)
1174    if col_list is None:
1175        col_list = []
1176    else:
1177        col_list = list(col_list)
1178    if len(col_list) <= 0:
1179        col_list = list(x.columns)
1180    x_set = set(x.columns)
1181    col_set = set(col_list)
1182    for ci in cols_to_copy:
1183        if (ci in x_set) and (ci not in col_set):
1184            col_list.append(ci)
1185    col_set = set(col_list)
1186    missing_cols = col_set - x_set
1187    if len(missing_cols) > 0:
1188        raise KeyError("referred to not-present columns " + str(missing_cols))
1189    cset = set(cols_to_copy)
1190    if len(col_list) <= 0:
1191        raise ValueError("no variables")
1192    x = x.loc[:, col_list]
1193    x = x.reset_index(inplace=False, drop=True)
1194    cat_col_set = None
1195    if cat_cols is not None:
1196        cat_col_set = set(cat_cols)
1197    for c in x.columns:
1198        if c in cset:
1199            continue
1200        bad_ind = vtreat.util.is_bad(x[c])
1201        if cat_col_set is not None:
1202            numeric_col = c not in cat_col_set
1203        else:
1204            numeric_col = vtreat.util.can_convert_v_to_numeric(x[c])
1205        if numeric_col:
1206            x[c] = vtreat.util.safe_to_numeric_array(x[c])
1207        else:
1208            # https://stackoverflow.com/questions/22231592/pandas-change-data-type-of-series-to-string
1209            x[c] = x[c].astype(str)
1210        x.loc[bad_ind, c] = None
1211    return x

Create a copy of pandas.DataFrame x restricted to col_list union cols_to_copy with col_list - cols_to_copy converted to only string and numeric types. New pandas.DataFrame has trivial indexing. If col_list is empty it is interpreted as all columns.

Parameters
  • x:
  • col_list:
  • cols_to_copy:
  • cat_cols:
Returns
def cross_patch_refit_y_aware_cols( *, x: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, y, res: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, plan: TreatmentPlan, cross_plan) -> None: 
1240def cross_patch_refit_y_aware_cols(
1241    *, x: pandas.DataFrame, y, res: pandas.DataFrame, plan: TreatmentPlan, cross_plan
1242) -> None:
1243    """
1244    Re fit the y-aware columns according to cross plan.
1245    Clears out refitter_ values to None.
1246    Assumes each y-aware variable produces one derived column.
1247
1248    :param x: explanatory values
1249    :param y: dependent values
1250    :param res: transformed frame to patch results into, altered
1251    :param plan: fitting plan
1252    :param cross_plan: cross validation plan
1253    :return: no return, res is altered in place
1254    """
1255
1256    if cross_plan is None or len(cross_plan) <= 1:
1257        for xf in plan.xforms:
1258            xf.refitter_ = None
1259        return
1260    incoming_colset = set(x.columns)
1261    derived_colset = set(res.columns)
1262    for xf in plan.xforms:
1263        if not xf.need_cross_treatment_:
1264            continue
1265        incoming_column_name = xf.incoming_column_name_
1266        derived_column_name = xf.derived_column_names_[0]
1267        if derived_column_name not in derived_colset:
1268            continue
1269        if incoming_column_name not in incoming_colset:
1270            raise KeyError("missing required column " + incoming_column_name)
1271        if xf.refitter_ is None:
1272            raise ValueError(
1273                "refitter is None: "
1274                + incoming_column_name
1275                + " -> "
1276                + derived_column_name
1277            )
1278
1279        # noinspection PyPep8Naming
1280        def maybe_transform(*, fit, X):
1281            """conditional patching"""
1282            if fit is None:
1283                return None
1284            return fit.transform(X)
1285
1286        patches = [
1287            maybe_transform(
1288                fit=xf.refitter_(
1289                    incoming_column_name=incoming_column_name,
1290                    x=x[incoming_column_name][cp["train"]],
1291                    y=y[cp["train"]],
1292                    extra_args=xf.extra_args_,
1293                    params=xf.params_,
1294                ),
1295                X=x.loc[cp["app"], [incoming_column_name]],
1296            )
1297            for cp in cross_plan
1298        ]
1299        # replace any missing sections with global average (slight data leak potential)
1300        avg = _mean_of_single_column_pandas_list(
1301            [pi for pi in patches if pi is not None]
1302        )
1303        if numpy.isnan(avg):
1304            avg = 0
1305        res[derived_column_name] = avg
1306        for i in range(len(cross_plan)):
1307            pi = patches[i]
1308            if pi is None:
1309                continue
1310            pi.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1311            cp = cross_plan[i]
1312            res.loc[cp["app"], derived_column_name] = numpy.asarray(
1313                pi[derived_column_name]
1314            ).reshape((len(pi),))
1315        res.loc[vtreat.util.is_bad(res[derived_column_name]), derived_column_name] = avg
1316    for xf in plan.xforms:
1317        xf.refitter_ = None

Re fit the y-aware columns according to cross plan. Clears out refitter_ values to None. Assumes each y-aware variable produces one derived column.

Parameters
  • x: explanatory values
  • y: dependent values
  • res: transformed frame to patch results into, altered
  • plan: fitting plan
  • cross_plan: cross validation plan
Returns

no return, res is altered in place

def cross_patch_user_y_aware_cols( *, x: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, y, res: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, params: Dict[str, Any], cross_plan) -> None: 
1320def cross_patch_user_y_aware_cols(
1321    *, x: pandas.DataFrame, y, res: pandas.DataFrame, params: Dict[str, Any], cross_plan
1322) -> None:
1323    """
1324    Re fit the user y-aware columns according to cross plan.
1325    Assumes each y-aware variable produces one derived column.
1326
1327    :param x: explanatory values
1328    :param y: dependent values
1329    :param res: transformed frame to patch results into, altered
1330    :param params: control parameter dictionary
1331    :param cross_plan: cross validation plan
1332    :return: no return, res altered in place
1333    """
1334    if cross_plan is None or len(cross_plan) <= 1:
1335        return
1336    incoming_colset = set(x.columns)
1337    derived_colset = set(res.columns)
1338    if len(derived_colset) <= 0:
1339        return
1340    for ut in params["user_transforms"]:
1341        if not ut.y_aware_:
1342            continue
1343        instersect_in = incoming_colset.intersection(set(ut.incoming_vars_))
1344        instersect_out = derived_colset.intersection(set(ut.derived_vars_))
1345        if len(instersect_out) <= 0:
1346            continue
1347        if len(instersect_out) != len(ut.derived_vars_):
1348            raise ValueError("not all derived columns are in res frame")
1349        if len(instersect_in) != len(ut.incoming_vars_):
1350            raise KeyError("missing required columns")
1351        patches = [
1352            ut.fit(X=x.loc[cp["train"], ut.incoming_vars_], y=y[cp["train"]]).transform(
1353                X=x.loc[cp["app"], ut.incoming_vars_]
1354            )
1355            for cp in cross_plan
1356        ]
1357        for col in ut.derived_vars_:
1358            # replace any missing sections with global average (slight data leak potential)
1359            avg = _mean_of_single_column_pandas_list(
1360                [pi.loc[:, [col]] for pi in patches if pi is not None]
1361            )
1362            if numpy.isnan(avg):
1363                avg = 0
1364            res[col] = avg
1365            for i in range(len(cross_plan)):
1366                pi = patches[i]
1367                if pi is None:
1368                    continue
1369                pi.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1370                cp = cross_plan[i]
1371                res.loc[cp["app"], col] = numpy.asarray(pi[col]).reshape((len(pi),))
1372            res.loc[vtreat.util.is_bad(res[col]), col] = avg

Re fit the user y-aware columns according to cross plan. Assumes each y-aware variable produces one derived column.

Parameters
  • x: explanatory values
  • y: dependent values
  • res: transformed frame to patch results into, altered
  • params: control parameter dictionary
  • cross_plan: cross validation plan
Returns

no return, res altered in place

def score_plan_variables( cross_frame: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, outcome, plan: TreatmentPlan, params: Dict[str, Any], *, is_classification: bool = False) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
1375def score_plan_variables(
1376    cross_frame: pandas.DataFrame,
1377    outcome,
1378    plan: TreatmentPlan,
1379    params: Dict[str, Any],
1380    *,
1381    is_classification: bool = False,
1382) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1383    """
1384    Quality score variables to build up score frame.
1385
1386    :param cross_frame: cross transformed explanatory variables
1387    :param outcome: dependent variable
1388    :param plan: treatment plan
1389    :param params: control parameter dictionary
1390    :param is_classification: logical, if True classification if False regression
1391    :return: score frame
1392    """
1393
1394    def describe_xf(xf):
1395        """describe variable transform"""
1396        description = pandas.DataFrame({"variable": xf.derived_column_names_})
1397        description["orig_variable"] = xf.incoming_column_name_
1398        description["treatment"] = xf.treatment_
1399        description["y_aware"] = xf.need_cross_treatment_
1400        return description
1401
1402    def describe_ut(ut):
1403        """describe user variable transform"""
1404        description = pandas.DataFrame(
1405            {"orig_variable": ut.incoming_vars_, "variable": ut.derived_vars_}
1406        )
1407        description["treatment"] = ut.treatment_
1408        description["y_aware"] = ut.y_aware_
1409        return description
1410
1411    var_table = pandas.concat(
1412        [describe_xf(xf) for xf in plan.xforms]
1413        + [
1414            describe_ut(ut)
1415            for ut in params["user_transforms"]
1416            if len(ut.incoming_vars_) > 0
1417        ],
1418        sort=False,
1419    )
1420    var_table.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1421    sf = vtreat.util.score_variables(
1422        cross_frame,
1423        variables=var_table["variable"],
1424        outcome=outcome,
1425        is_classification=is_classification,
1426    )
1427    score_frame = pandas.merge(var_table, sf, how="left", on=["variable"], sort=False)
1428    num_treatment_types = len(score_frame["treatment"].unique())
1429    score_frame["_one"] = 1.0
1430    score_frame["vcount"] = score_frame.groupby("treatment")["_one"].transform("sum")
1431    score_frame["default_threshold"] = 1.0 / (
1432        score_frame["vcount"] * num_treatment_types
1433    )
1434    score_frame.drop(["_one"], axis=1, inplace=True)
1435    score_frame["recommended"] = numpy.logical_and(
1436        score_frame["has_range"],
1437        numpy.logical_and(
1438            numpy.logical_not(
1439                numpy.logical_or(
1440                    numpy.isnan(score_frame["significance"]),
1441                    numpy.isnan(score_frame["PearsonR"]),
1442                )
1443            ),
1444            numpy.logical_and(
1445                score_frame["significance"] < score_frame["default_threshold"],
1446                numpy.logical_or(
1447                    score_frame["PearsonR"] > 0.0,
1448                    numpy.logical_not(score_frame["y_aware"]),
1449                ),
1450            ),
1451        ),
1452    )
1453    return score_frame

Quality score variables to build up score frame.

Parameters
  • cross_frame: cross transformed explanatory variables
  • outcome: dependent variable
  • plan: treatment plan
  • params: control parameter dictionary
  • is_classification: logical, if True classification if False regression
Returns

score frame

def pseudo_score_plan_variables( *, cross_frame, plan: TreatmentPlan, params: Dict[str, Any]) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
1456def pseudo_score_plan_variables(
1457    *, cross_frame, plan: TreatmentPlan, params: Dict[str, Any]
1458) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1459    """
1460    Build a score frame look-alike for unsupervised case.
1461
1462    :param cross_frame: cross transformed explanatory variables
1463    :param plan: treatment plan
1464    :param params: control parameter dictionary
1465    :return: score frame
1466    """
1467
1468    def describe_xf(xf):
1469        """describe variable transform"""
1470        description = pandas.DataFrame({"variable": xf.derived_column_names_})
1471        description["orig_variable"] = xf.incoming_column_name_
1472        description["treatment"] = xf.treatment_
1473        description["y_aware"] = xf.need_cross_treatment_
1474        return description
1475
1476    def describe_ut(ut):
1477        """describe user variable transform"""
1478        description = pandas.DataFrame(
1479            {"orig_variable": ut.incoming_vars_, "variable": ut.derived_vars_}
1480        )
1481        description["treatment"] = ut.treatment_
1482        description["y_aware"] = ut.y_aware_
1483        return description
1484
1485    score_frame = pandas.concat(
1486        [describe_xf(xf) for xf in plan.xforms]
1487        + [
1488            describe_ut(ut)
1489            for ut in params["user_transforms"]
1490            if len(ut.incoming_vars_) > 0
1491        ],
1492        sort=False,
1493    )
1494    score_frame.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1495
1496    score_frame["has_range"] = [
1497        vtreat.util.numeric_has_range(cross_frame[c]) for c in score_frame["variable"]
1498    ]
1499    score_frame["PearsonR"] = numpy.nan
1500    score_frame["significance"] = numpy.nan
1501    score_frame["recommended"] = score_frame["has_range"].copy()
1502    score_frame["_one"] = 1.0
1503    score_frame["vcount"] = score_frame.groupby("treatment")["_one"].transform("sum")
1504    score_frame.drop(["_one"], axis=1, inplace=True)
1505    return score_frame

Build a score frame look-alike for unsupervised case.

Parameters
  • cross_frame: cross transformed explanatory variables
  • plan: treatment plan
  • params: control parameter dictionary
Returns

score frame

class VariableTreatment(abc.ABC, sklearn.base.BaseEstimator, sklearn.base.TransformerMixin): 
1508class VariableTreatment(
1509    abc.ABC, sklearn.base.BaseEstimator, sklearn.base.TransformerMixin
1510):
1511    """
1512    Class for variable treatments, implements much of the sklearn pipeline/transformer
1513    API. https://sklearn-template.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user_guide.html#transformer
1514    """
1515
1516    result_restriction: Optional[Set[str]]
1517    outcome_name_: Optional[str]
1518    outcome_target_: Optional[Any]
1519    var_list_: List[str]
1520    cols_to_copy_: List[str]
1521    params_: Dict[str, Any]
1522    plan_: Optional[TreatmentPlan]
1523    score_frame_: Optional[pandas.DataFrame]
1524    imputation_map_: Dict[str, Callable]
1525    last_fit_x_id_: Optional[str]
1526    cross_plan_: Optional[List[Dict[str, List[int]]]]
1527    cross_rows_: Optional[int]
1528    last_result_columns: Optional[List[str]]

1530    def __init__(
1531        self,
1532        *,
1533        var_list: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
1534        outcome_name: Optional[str] = None,
1535        outcome_target: Optional[Any] = None,
1536        cols_to_copy: Optional[Iterable[str]] = None,
1537        params: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
1538        imputation_map: Optional[Dict[str, Any]] = None,
1539    ):
1540        """
1541
1542        :param var_list: variables we intend to encode, empty means all
1543        :param outcome_name: column name of outcome
1544        :param outcome_target: outcome column value we consider in class or True
1545        :param cols_to_copy: columns to not process, but copy over
1546        :param params: control and configuration parameters
1547        :param imputation_map: per column imputation strategies or values
1548        """
1549        if var_list is None:
1550            var_list = []
1551        else:
1552            var_list = vtreat.util.unique_items_in_order(var_list)
1553        if cols_to_copy is None:
1554            cols_to_copy = []
1555        else:
1556            cols_to_copy = vtreat.util.unique_items_in_order(cols_to_copy)
1557        if (outcome_name is not None) and (outcome_name not in set(cols_to_copy)):
1558            cols_to_copy.append(outcome_name)
1559        confused = set(cols_to_copy).intersection(set(var_list))
1560        if len(confused) > 0:
1561            raise ValueError(
1562                "variables in treatment plan and non-treatment: " + ", ".join(confused)
1563            )
1564        if imputation_map is None:
1565            imputation_map = dict()
1566        self.outcome_name_ = outcome_name
1567        self.outcome_target_ = outcome_target
1568        self.var_list_ = [vi for vi in var_list if vi not in set(cols_to_copy)]
1569        self.cols_to_copy_ = cols_to_copy
1570        if params is not None:
1571            self.params_ = params.copy()
1572        else:
1573            self.params_ = dict()
1574        self.imputation_map_ = imputation_map.copy()
1575        self.plan_ = None
1576        self.score_frame_ = None
1577        self.cross_rows_ = None
1578        self.cross_plan_ = None
1579        self.last_fit_x_id_ = None
1580        self.last_result_columns = None
1581        self.result_restriction = None
1582        self.clear()
1583
1584    def check_column_names(self, col_names: Iterable[str]) -> None:
1585        """
1586        Check that none of the column names we are working with are non-unique.
1587        Also check variable columns are all present (columns to copy and outcome allowed to be missing).
1588
1589        :param col_names:
1590        :return: None, raises exception if there is a problem
1591        """
1592
1593        col_names = [c for c in col_names]
1594        to_check = set(self.var_list_)
1595        if self.outcome_name_ is not None:
1596            to_check.add(self.outcome_name_)
1597        if self.cols_to_copy_ is not None:
1598            to_check.update(self.cols_to_copy_)
1599        seen = [c for c in col_names if c in to_check]
1600        if len(seen) != len(set(seen)):
1601            raise ValueError("duplicate column names in frame")
1602        missing = set(self.var_list_) - set(col_names)
1603        if len(missing) > 0:
1604            raise ValueError(f"missing required columns: {missing}")
1605
1606    def clear(self) -> None:
1607        """reset state"""
1608        self.plan_ = None
1609        self.score_frame_ = None
1610        self.cross_rows_ = None
1611        self.cross_plan_ = None
1612        self.last_fit_x_id_ = None
1613        self.last_result_columns = None
1614        self.result_restriction = None
1615
1616    def get_result_restriction(self):
1617        """accessor"""
1618        if self.result_restriction is None:
1619            return None
1620        return self.result_restriction.copy()
1621
1622    def set_result_restriction(self, new_vars) -> None:
1623        """setter"""
1624        self.result_restriction = None
1625        if (new_vars is not None) and (len(new_vars) > 0):
1626            self.result_restriction = set(new_vars)

1676        """

1687        """
1688        vtreat exposes a subset of controls as tunable parameters, users can choose this set
1689        by specifying the tunable_params list in object construction parameters
1690
1691        :param params:
1692        :return: self (for method chaining)
1693        """
1694
1695        for k, v in params.items():
1696            if k in self.params_["tunable_params"]:
1697                self.params_[k] = v

1738    # https://github.com/scikit-learn/scikit-learn/blob/master/sklearn/compose/_column_transformer.py
1739
1740    def get_feature_names(self, input_features=None):
1741        """
1742        Get list of produced feature names.
1743
1744        :param input_features: Optional, restrict to these features
1745        :return:
1746        """
1747        if self.score_frame_ is None:
1748            raise ValueError(
1749                "get_feature_names called on uninitialized vtreat transform"
1750            )
1751        if input_features is not None:
1752            input_features = [c for c in input_features]
1753        filter_to_recommended = False
1754        try:
1755            filter_to_recommended = self.params_["filter_to_recommended"]
1756        except KeyError:
1757            pass
1758        if filter_to_recommended:
1759            new_vars = [
1760                self.score_frame_["variable"][i]
1761                for i in range(self.score_frame_.shape[0])
1762                if self.score_frame_["has_range"][i]
1763                and self.score_frame_["recommended"][i]
1764                and (
1765                    input_features is None
1766                    or self.score_frame_["orig_variable"][i] in input_features
1767                )
1768            ]
1769        else:
1770            new_vars = [
1771                self.score_frame_["variable"][i]
1772                for i in range(self.score_frame_.shape[0])
1773                if self.score_frame_["has_range"][i]
1774                and (
1775                    input_features is None
1776                    or self.score_frame_["orig_variable"][i] in input_features
1777                )
1778            ]
1779        new_vars = new_vars + self.cols_to_copy_
1780        return new_vars
1781
1782    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1783        """
1784        Return description of transform as a data frame. Does not encode user steps. Not yet implemented for
1785        multinomial dependent variables.
1786
1787        :return: description of transform.
1788        """
1789
1790        assert self.plan_ is not None  # type hint
1791        assert self.score_frame_ is not None  # type hint
1792        xform_steps = [xfi for xfi in self.plan_.xforms]
1793        frames = [xfi.description_matrix() for xfi in xform_steps]
1794        res = pandas.concat(frames).reset_index(inplace=False, drop=True)
1795        # restrict down to non-constant variables
1796        scored_vars = set(self.score_frame_["variable"][self.score_frame_["has_range"]])
1797        usable = [v in scored_vars for v in res["variable"]]
1798        res = res.loc[usable, :].reset_index(inplace=False, drop=True)
1799        return res

1744        :param input_features: Optional, restrict to these features
1745        :return:
1746        """
1747        if self.score_frame_ is None:
1748            raise ValueError(
1749                "get_feature_names called on uninitialized vtreat transform"
1750            )
1751        if input_features is not None:
1752            input_features = [c for c in input_features]
1753        filter_to_recommended = False
1754        try:
1755            filter_to_recommended = self.params_["filter_to_recommended"]
1756        except KeyError:
1757            pass
1758        if filter_to_recommended:
1759            new_vars = [
1760                self.score_frame_["variable"][i]
1761                for i in range(self.score_frame_.shape[0])
1762                if self.score_frame_["has_range"][i]
1763                and self.score_frame_["recommended"][i]
1764                and (
1765                    input_features is None
1766                    or self.score_frame_["orig_variable"][i] in input_features
1767                )
1768            ]
1769        else:
1770            new_vars = [
1771                self.score_frame_["variable"][i]
1772                for i in range(self.score_frame_.shape[0])
1773                if self.score_frame_["has_range"][i]
1774                and (
1775                    input_features is None
1776                    or self.score_frame_["orig_variable"][i] in input_features
1777                )
1778            ]
1779        new_vars = new_vars + self.cols_to_copy_
1780        return new_vars

def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
1782    def description_matrix(self) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1783        """
1784        Return description of transform as a data frame. Does not encode user steps. Not yet implemented for
1785        multinomial dependent variables.
1786
1787        :return: description of transform.
1788        """
1789
1790        assert self.plan_ is not None  # type hint
1791        assert self.score_frame_ is not None  # type hint
1792        xform_steps = [xfi for xfi in self.plan_.xforms]
1793        frames = [xfi.description_matrix() for xfi in xform_steps]
1794        res = pandas.concat(frames).reset_index(inplace=False, drop=True)
1795        # restrict down to non-constant variables
1796        scored_vars = set(self.score_frame_["variable"][self.score_frame_["has_range"]])
1797        usable = [v in scored_vars for v in res["variable"]]
1798        res = res.loc[usable, :].reset_index(inplace=False, drop=True)
1799        return res

def perform_transform( *, x: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, transform: VariableTreatment, params: Dict[str, Any]) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
1802def perform_transform(
1803    *, x: pandas.DataFrame, transform: VariableTreatment, params: Dict[str, Any]
1804) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1805    """
1806    Transform a data frame.
1807
1808    :param x: data to be transformed.
1809    :param transform: transform
1810    :param params: control parameter dictionary
1811    :return: new data frame
1812    """
1813    assert transform.plan_ is not None  # type hint
1814    xform_steps = [xfi for xfi in transform.plan_.xforms]
1815    user_steps = [stp for stp in params["user_transforms"]]
1816    # restrict down to to results we are going to use
1817    if (transform.result_restriction is not None) and (
1818        len(transform.result_restriction) > 0
1819    ):
1820        xform_steps = [
1821            xfi
1822            for xfi in xform_steps
1823            if len(
1824                set(xfi.derived_column_names_).intersection(
1825                    transform.result_restriction
1826                )
1827            )
1828            > 0
1829        ]
1830        user_steps = [
1831            stp
1832            for stp in user_steps
1833            if len(set(stp.derived_vars_).intersection(transform.result_restriction))
1834            > 0
1835        ]
1836    # check all required columns are present
1837    needs = set()
1838    for xfi in xform_steps:
1839        if xfi.incoming_column_name_ is not None:
1840            needs.add(xfi.incoming_column_name_)
1841    for stp in user_steps:
1842        if stp.incoming_vars_ is not None:
1843            needs.update(stp.incoming_vars_)
1844    missing = needs - set(x.columns)
1845    if len(missing) > 0:
1846        raise ValueError("missing required input columns " + str(missing))
1847    # do the work
1848    new_frames = [xfi.transform(x) for xfi in (xform_steps + user_steps)]
1849    new_frames = [frm for frm in new_frames if (frm is not None) and (frm.shape[1] > 0)]
1850    # see if we want to copy over any columns
1851    copy_set = set(transform.plan_.cols_to_copy)
1852    to_copy = [ci for ci in x.columns if ci in copy_set]
1853    if len(to_copy) > 0:
1854        cp = x.loc[:, to_copy].copy()
1855        new_frames = [cp] + new_frames
1856    if len(new_frames) <= 0:
1857        raise ValueError("no columns transformed")
1858    res = pandas.concat(new_frames, axis=1, sort=False)
1859    res.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1860    return res

Transform a data frame.

Parameters
  • x: data to be transformed.
  • transform: transform
  • params: control parameter dictionary

def limit_to_appropriate_columns( *, res: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, transform: VariableTreatment) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
1863def limit_to_appropriate_columns(
1864    *, res: pandas.DataFrame, transform: VariableTreatment
1865) -> pandas.DataFrame:
1866    """
1867    Limit down to appropriate columns.
1868
1869    :param res:
1870    :param transform:
1871    :return:
1872    """
1873    assert transform.plan_ is not None  # type hint
1874    assert transform.score_frame_ is not None  # type hint
1875    to_copy = set(transform.plan_.cols_to_copy)
1876    to_take = set(
1877        [
1878            ci
1879            for ci in transform.score_frame_["variable"][
1880                transform.score_frame_["has_range"]
1881            ]
1882        ]
1883    )
1884    if (transform.result_restriction is not None) and (
1885        len(transform.result_restriction) > 0
1886    ):
1887        to_take = to_take.intersection(transform.result_restriction)
1888    cols_to_keep = [ci for ci in res.columns if (ci in to_copy) or (ci in to_take)]
1889    if len(cols_to_keep) <= 0:
1890        raise ValueError("no columns retained")
1891    res = res[cols_to_keep].copy()
1892    res.reset_index(inplace=True, drop=True)
1893    return res
